Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: For over two years no one including myself has been able to pull my credit report from Experian. Two years ago I submitted all the documentation that they requested to prove my identity and my address. Still no one including myself call pull my credit report from Experian. This has prevented me from obtaining credit and most importantly from refinancing my home. I have called them almost daily for the past two weeks. I have been told that I will receive calls from an escalated ticket. No one has called. I finally received an email on Sunday XX/XX/2021 basically saying that the ticket was closed, pay for an account with Experian to get further assistance. So I called today and was told that I needed an account with Experian. Then I was told that I had to call back in 72 hours to receive an assistance. I have spent more than 15 hours on the telephone trying to get Experian to fix a problem that they have created. It has to be a problem with Experian because I can pull my credit report just fine from XXXX  and XXXX. I feel as though I am being held XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
FICO CREDIT SCORE DROPPING W/O VALID REASON! 

In the month of XX/XX/XXXX, I was notified TWICE by Experian, that my FICO score had dropped - once by 9 points on XX/XX/XXXX from XXXX to XXXX and again by 3 points on XXXX XXXX to XXXX. I ran a credit report on XXXX XXXX which states at it's very end about my FICO Score 8 - " you have NO negative factors impacting your score ''. This report states 1 ) No missed payments 2 ) Long Credit History ( 23+ yrs ) 3 ) Recent card usage 4 ) Substantial installment loan repayment ( mortgage ) I have 2 Credit cards & I pay them in FULL monthly ( exceptional payment history ) & we pay extra on our declining balance on our joint mortgage ( never missed a payment ). 

I called Experian about this matter TWICE. I called on Sat. XX/XX/XXXX & was advised to call on a weekday. I called on Monday, XXXX at XXXX XXXX & was rebuffed from speaking with a Supervisor & also told that there was NO EXPLANATION to give for this. He agent stated " I am not a credit repair person '' - he gave me a laundry list of " why '' a FICO score could decline, but NONE of them apply. He had nothing else to offer except to try to SELL me " credit repair '' services that I do not need. I was NOT given ANY further opportunity to address this matter with Experian. 

I am concerned about my FICO score dropping further and further, as there is no evidence of any fraud & I AM using my credit responsibly & paying my bills in FULL monthly. I feel I may be targeted or something as I have no explanation for how someone with a decent income, who is receiving e-mails from Experian congratulation them on " low utilization '' and other such markers, could then have them drop their FICO score? I do not know if it is because of my age or gender, but it seems to be not tied to my actual credit usage, payments or income, or any other actual markers.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX I had contacted my current lender, Freedom Mortgage, about a refinance of my existing loan with them. They followed-up quickly and said they needed to wait for the required VA seasoning period before we could proceed. After that period had passed we reengaged and I was sent a final closing disclosure and scheduled for a closing on XX/XX/2021 at my home at XXXX. I was contacted at XXXX by the law firm and told the closing had to be cancelled because Freedom Mortgage failed to get them the required documents. I contacted Freedom Mortgage that day and learned that they were unable to determine a projected property tax for escrow. I notified them that this was originally part of a trust and that the bill wouldn't be generated until XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX. They stated they would contact XXXX County, SC to get an estimate to use for the tax certificate. Once I had been assured that had happened on XX/XX/2021 I scheduled for a closing on XX/XX/2021 at XXXX at my home. I was contacted at by the law firm at XXXX and told the closing had to be cancelled and to contact Freedom Mortgage for further details. I contacted Freedom Mortgage and was told that they had the same issue about the tax certificate. I had been assured it was cleared up, but surely enough it wasn't. When I spoke to a representative for the " exceptions department '' on the phone I was told they had two different tax amounts and couldn't proceed until they received confirmation from the tax authority. That is now twice in two months, with the closing scheduled 12 calendar days in advance that Freedom Mortgage was unable to execute a scheduled mortgage closing for an IRRRL due to their inability to gather and relate information competently. I have made inquiries to other companies as this process has proceeded causing a dip in my credit scores as well as having to cancel on my required witnesses who had cleared their schedules.

On XX/XX/2020 when I made the first payment I asked teh debt collector reprsentative that was taking my payment that once I made the final payment would there be something sent to the creditors on my behalf to remove or delete as that was what I requested and they said yes once the final payment had been recieved. They also informed me that they will automatically mail me out a letter stating that it had been paid in full. I explained that the last representative that I spoke with did not tell me that I needed to call in however, she stated that it was something that they automatically did. Also, to have it removed or deleted the representative told me that it was something that was available upon request which I did request However, only to find out that this has not been removed or deleted from my credit. According to my research this is a UDAAP violation when there is Diceptive Acts of Practice which was very misleading for me and an very unnessary process to do the things that I need to do.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Despite several written requests, the unverified bankruptcies listed on my report still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a COPY of the ORIGINAL documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. Your company have not sent me any documentation that verify the information they are reporting. In the results of your first investigation and subsequent reinvestigation, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly? Your company have said the courthouse verified the public record which is a lie, I contacted the bankruptcy court and I sent a letter directly from the courthouse stating they do not verify with 3rd parties. Which I have attached to this complaint. It is also illegal to report inaccurate information on my report that has not been accurate verified. You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ). Your company have failed to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX I C SYSTEM XXXX I.C. SYSTEM, INC XXXX Your company have violated FCRA 615 ( f ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( f ) ) ( f ) Prohibition on sale or transfer of debt caused by identity theft You have not responded to my request to provide me with an investigation report.

I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft.

( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ). 
( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity. 
A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information. 
The reference items are listed below please take this matter very serious I C SYSTEM XXXX I.C. SYSTEM, INC XXXX I have report your company to consumerfinance.gov As a form of record and I am prepare to sue your company Example In re XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Telephone Consumer Protection Act Litigation, Case No. XXXX, in the U.S. District Court for the XXXX District of California Stop collection proceedings against me Signatures on applications and accounts Investigators report XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The CFPB Complaint # XXXX stated : It is understood the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) requires a creditor or other business to give copies of applications and other business records relating to transactions and accounts when requested in writing. In its XX/XX/XXXX Annual Credit Report number XXXX - Experian XXXX dispute and subsequent communications Experian reported it received and verified all transactions and accounts of XXXX-XXXX XXXX # XXXX. Upon phoning XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( obstructions totaling 123 minutes ) and speaking with XXXX, XXXX and many others and XX/XX/XXXX Experian Customer Experience Survey Case # XXXX Experian again confirmed the existence of its verified records provided by XXXX but refused provision of these business records relating to transactions and accounts. Experian has been repeatedly, in writing, requested for 178 days to provide applications and all other business records relating to fraudulent XXXX-XXXX XXXX  # XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX, ( XXXX ) XXXX transactions and accounts. Please immediately provide all documents/records by return email to XXXX. 

On XXXX XXXX, XXXX Experian responded Report Number : XXXX Date Generated : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX. The information you disputed has been verified as accurate ; however, information unrelated to your dispute has been updated. Please review your report for the details. Our reinvestigation of the dispute ( s ) and/or other request ( s ) you recently submitted is now complete. If we were able to make changes to your credit report based on information you provided, or if you requested the addition of a statement, we have done so. Otherwise, we have contacted the company reporting the information you disputed, supplied them all relevant information and any documents you gave us with your dispute, and instructed them to : review all information we provide them about your dispute ; verify the accuracy of the information ; provide us a response to your dispute ; and update their records and systems as necessary.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
There was an inquiry on my Experian credit report from XX/XX/2020, that was a result of identity theft. I discovered this during a review of my credit report. I called Experian and they told me to contact the reporting company. I immediately put a freeze on my credit reports. I called XXXX who made the inquiry and was told that the inquiry was from XXXX XXXX. I spoke to the dealership manager who told me about the applicant who applied for the credit. I verified my information and proved it was not me who applied for the credit. I spoke to XXXX and was told to file a police report and a report with Identitytheft.gov. I did both of these and emailed them the reports asking them to remove the inquiry from my credit report. 

When I spoke to XXXX at XXXX today, she told me that they now require me to send them a copy of my social security number, my driver 's license, and a copy of a utility bill. I told her that they never requested that information before and asked her if I sent them the additional documents if they would immediately remove the inquiry from my report and she was not able to guarantee me that they would. I told her that the information they are requesting is very sensitive and I do not feel comfortable releasing this information to a company that has not been authorized to receive this information and they could use it to further steal my identity now that they have a copy of my social security card, driver 's license, and utility bill. How can I be sure that they are not part of the identity theft scam? 

In essence, I told her that they are re-victimizing me by refusing to remove a fraudulent inquiry in spite of proof from a police report which they requested.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/2020 we made a reservation for a XXXX in XXXX, XXXX and paid a deposit of XXXX to reserve the place which was going to be used to celebrate my XXXX birthday on XXXX XXXX. 
Then XXXX happened and we could not travel. We disputed the charge with my credit card company ( Barclays Credit Card Account # XXXX ) and the bank said that they could not dispute this amount because the merchant had no refund or cancellation policy that dealt with XXXX. 
While I understand that the merchant had a no refund cancellation policy that dealt with XXXX, I would like to appeal the rejection of this dispute on the grounds of extreme unforeseen circumstances, since no one really could predict this pandemic and no company was having a clause for this item back in XXXX when I booked the place. 
Given the current pandemic, there is no way we will be able to travel to XXXX for the foreseeable future. We have contacted the merchant on several occasions and were informed we would have a year to claim our credit. This seems extremely unfair and a breach of the original contract, considering that there is no telling when we will be able to travel in the near future, let alone to an international destination, that is currently devastated by an ongoing and uncontrolled pandemic. As you may know, Mexico has seen an increasing rise of COVID cases totaling around 408,499 confirmed, with some experts estimating the real figures closer to 7 million, given testing limitations. It is unreasonable to expect anyone to travel to this destination safely within a years time and therefore we will not be able to claim our credit and forfeit the full amount of our deposit. 
We sent a letter appealing the credit card company decision on XX/XX/2020 and Barclays Bank has not responded or resolved this issue.

I called ( was on hold for 2 hrs ) and they said it was a system outage and not to worry, my account wasnt closed. However, they erroneously reported to credit agencies a derogatory closure & charge-off of {$880.00}. XXXX has not responded as to if or when this error will be fixed. Many others online are reporting similar hits to their credit reports/scores. Those with XXXX are trying to rebuild their credit, and must not be taken advantage of.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
There was a data breach with XXXX credit bureau during the summer of 2017 that put my personal information at risk. There was also a fake loan company, called XXXX, that tricked me into giving them my personal information including my sign-on credentials for online banking : user id and passwords. This resulted in a fraudulent auto loan from a company called XXXX XXXX XXXX to be on my credit report. The thieves also tampered with my XXXX XXXX XXXX  accounts and credit cards which caused collection agencies to be involved. I've been disputing the auto loan with XXXX, but they keep asking for more information from identitytheft.gov. I asked one of the agents about more information, and she said the seven-step recovery plan they created for me is all they have on identitytheft.gov. This includes letters to creditors, credit bureaus, and the FCRA. 
Sad to say I'm still struggling with identity theft right now, as I've been informed that there have been some disputes on my credit report that I did not initiate or request.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I have a major credit card with XXXX Mastercard. Recently XX/XX/2021 I entered into an agreement with them for 6 months with this card. The agreement is to pay {$50.00} per month at an interest rate of 5.9 % for the 6 months. I was told on XX/XX/2021 that I need to make the first inital payment of {$50.00} which I did with the rep. Going forward I also agreed to have the payments come out of my account each month. I confirmed that the account would be considered in good standing and current. I was assured " yes ''. On XX/XX/2021 I received a text that the account is past due. I immediately called XXXX mastercard and was told that I need to make another {$20.00} payment. I made the {$20.00} payment. I asked why is the account reporting now as late when I was assured after I made the {$50.00} payment the account would be considered current. I would have paid the {$70.00} if that is what they were requiring to go into this program on that day instead of the account showing as late. I am upset at the fact that I might be charged a late fee and in addition that it's going to be reported to the credit reporting agency 's again. I have been disputing with them about 2 negative remarks that are already reporting when in fact I went through this with them back in XXXX when the pandemic hit.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a notice of assignment to collection agency from Professional Account Management , LLC for {$50.00}. This is for administrative fee assessed by the New Jersey XXXX XXXX. 
Due to COVID-19, the toll plazas were closed and signs on the highway instructing drivers that tolls will be sent by mail. I have received my toll bills in mid-XXXX XXXX ( on or around XX/XX/XXXX ). I paid my toll bill online and disputed the administrative fee through their website. 
I received an email receipt for the toll payment with a note that my dispute of the administrative fees ( {$100.00}, originally round trip ) will be reviewed and I will be notified. I have never heard back by email or otherwise from the New Jersey XXXX XXXX until the collection letter from XXXX, XXXX sent to me on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I have attempted to dispute the collection with XXXX to no avail, called multiple times and it was clear that they can not be reached by phone by design. I have tried to work through the XXXX  of XXXX to get their attention and have someone reached me by phone, and they were more interested in blaming me than honestly attempt to reach me. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent them a letter to dispute the charges and try to find a solution and I have yet to hear from them. They denied receiving any communication from me even though I attached a copy of the letter I sent them, which does not give me confidence that they are dealing with me with honesty and fairness. I am disputing the {$50.00} charge because I was not at fault when the New Jersey XXXX XXXX fails to send me the toll bills on time. Ultimately, I paid my toll bills but I will not give them the pleasure of acquiescing to them trying to collect through a collection agency. I was never, ever received any mail from a collection agency because I pay my bills, and my excellent credit score proves it. I simply dont want XXXX to damage it.

I am not sure what else to do at this point. This derogatory remark is ruining me and my families ability to apply for any type of loans. During these difficult times.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I called XXXX XXXX to request a downgrade of my XXXX  XXXX XX/XX/XXXX card as I was no longer interested in paying the {$170.00} annual fee. I didn't think the fee justified the cards benefit. The representative presented various credit cards I could downgrade to that did not have an annual fee. After a 90-minute conversation, I decided to downgrade to the lower tier of the XX/XX/XXXX card that did not the annual key. I also allowed the representative to charge my checking account for the annual fee of {$170.00} in case the downgrade process takes long in order to avoid being charge a late fee since the annual fee was due. The representative ensured me everything be process and I will receive the new card in a few weeks. 

In the first half of XXXX, I spent a lot of times traveling which was extended due to the pandemic. I was in the west coast until XX/XX/XXXX. When I returned home in XXXX, I found several letters from XXXX XXXX stating that I owed them {$170.00} plus late fees/interest. Also, my credit report was flagged for missed payment. At first, I was confused and thought maybe someone stole the new card while I was away and used it. Because I know that I didn't owe XXXX XXXX anything especially since I paid them the {$170.00} annual fee back in XXXX to avoid any issues relating to downgrading my card. 

After having several conversations with XXXX XXXX bank tellers and two Case Specialist in the XXXX XXXX XXXX Complaints Management Office, they confirmed that the representative did not downgrade the card as he ensured me, he will do. Furthermore, they confirmed that they did receive my payment for the annual fee back in XXXX but failed to update my account with the new balance ( which was {$0.00} ) which resulted in them reporting me to the credit bureau. To explain, XXXX XXXX continued to charge me for the annual fee even though I had already paid them the fee. Every month from XXXX to XXXX they reported a missed payment to all three credit bureaus. They apologized for their mistake and ensure me that they will contact the credit bureau to remove all the negative marks they put on my account as this was their negligence for not verifying their information about my account. It is now XX/XX/XXXX ( I spoke to them XXXX XXXX ) and the missed payment has not been removed. I also open a dispute with Experian and Experian said they refuse to remove it. It seems like the only thing left to do is to take them to court because they are violating the federal fair credit reporting act ( FCRA ) and has damaged my creditworthiness.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Back on XX/XX/2020 I went back to work after being furloughed due to covid. My hours were cut from 40 hours a week to 30 hours a week. This was due to covid and the pandemic.

My car company was aware of my hardship and had even notated my account as affected by covid. My fianc is in the entertainment industry. Hes been out of work and waiting on unemployment due to covid. So basically Ive been supporting a family of 5 by myself. I had advised Flagship and they were aware of the situation. In late XXXX I made a full payment. 
Theyd offered me an extension. When I called back in XXXX to verify it still hadnt been approved. So they advised they were requesting two extensions due to loss of hours and theyd place on end of loan. They never said anything about it hurting my credit. Instead they said to call back and verify if it was approved or not. So I kept calling and finally it was approved in XXXX. As long as I made a full payment. Please see attachments. 

Then came my credit. XXXX XXXX, 30 days past due. I disputed then it changed to XXXX. I disputed and now its changed to XXXX. I spoke with a Supervisor she advised it would be fixed. I wrote a letter only for them to write back saying its valid. 

In good faith I made an agreement based on my loss of hours because of covid. Now my credit has been adversely effected. They even took the comment off my account stating that Ive been effected by covid.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I requested for Experian to remove the bankruptcy from my credit report because the information they received is incorrect and was not received directly through the bankruptcy court. In the State of New Jersey, the bankruptcy court DOES NOT report to the credit bureaus at all, therefore making this record unverifiable. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly? Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified.

Still dont have an answer why XXXX point drop for using the card. I shouldn't be punished for using my first card and wonder how many people they are doing this to? Very sad, very angry. My life dreams are on hold because of this.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I received a copy of my credit report and noticed there was some information on my report that is inaccurate. I am in the process of buying a home and the information that is being shown is holding up the process. According to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 611 ( a ) [ 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ], these disputed items must be reinvestigated or deleted from my credit record within 30 days. During the investigation period, the item I am disputing must be removed from my credit report as the mere reporting of items prior to debt validation constitutes collection activity. I am also requesting my name, address, and telephone number updated and remove any other names, addresses, and telephone numbers that do not belong to me. The following account in dispute is listed below : XXXX XXXX  # XXXX, DEPT OF ED/XXXX  # XXXX, XXXX  # XXXX, XXXX  # XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  # XXXX, XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, My current address is XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, OH. XXXX. Please notify me that the above items have been deleted pursuant to 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) [ 15 USC1681j ( a ) ( 6 ). I am also requesting an updated copy of my credit report, which should be sent to the address listed below. According to the provisions of 612 [ 15 USC 1681j ], there should be no charge for this report.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Barclaycard to dispute several late fee assessments on my account and their failure to reply to email and written disputes of said amounts on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. My account due date is the XXXX of each month and the fees that I'm disputing are characterized as late fees : XX/XX/XXXX ( {$40.00} XXXX despite payments : XX/XX/XXXX of {$300.00}, XX/XX/XXXX of {$100.00} and XX/XX/XXXX of {$160.00} ; XX/XX/XXXX ( {$29.00} XXXX despite payments of : XX/XX/XXXX of {$170.00}, XX/XX/XXXX of {$100.00} and XX/XX/XXXX of {$100.00} ; XX/XX/XXXX ( {$29.00} XXXX despite payments of : XX/XX/XXXX of {$200.00}. 

I spoke with representative XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, as the phone lines were closed the majority of the year due to COVID and I had been unable to reach anyone by phone, email or letter until this date. XXXX advised that Barclays closes their billing cycle on the XXXX of every month and as such will apply any payments made prior to the XXXX to the prior month 's billing. I advised that I make payments exclusively online through my In Home Support Services worker because I am disabled and pay someone to come in to handle my legal affairs at the beginning and end of each month. At no point in time did the website indicate that payments made on that day would not apply to the monthly payment. In fact, the minimum payment for the month showing as owing is always listed and gives the account holder the belief that it is being paid. 

I asked XXXX to transfer my call to manager XXXX XXXX XXXX, as I disagreed with their policy of assessing late fees for timely payments without providing any type of notice, as well as their failure to answer emails and written complaints regarding previous late fees, as I would've been apprised of their policy had they responded to my earlier disputes. 

XXXX refused to apply the payment that I made today for {$77.00} to my XX/XX/XXXX due date despite the fact that I told her that the payment was made online XX/XX/XXXX for my XX/XX/XXXX due date and that COVID has left me unable to make additional payments. Additionally, she refused to refund any late fees from XXXX despite their failure to respond to my previous disputes and only promised to provide a credit for the {$40.00} late fee assessed on XX/XX/XXXX in a future billing cycle. 

In most months, I make between 2-3 payments to help pay off my card sooner. At no time did their website alert me to the fact that my payments were not being recorded appropriately and they never responded to my inquiries to clarify their policies to allow me to make any changes.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: I own a vacation rental property and a man named XXXX XXXX reached out to to me through XXXX and wanted to rent my vacation home. He said his company was paying so he needed to send a check. When I received the check ( from XXXX XXXX, XXXX in XXXX, TN on a Bank of America check ) it was for more than he owed and he asked me to XXXX the difference once the check clears. I electronic deposited it to my checking account at Bank of America, it showed cleared later that day and I sent the difference of {$2200.00} via XXXX to XXXX XXXX at email XXXX, which was also a Bank of America account. A few days later, XXXX said he had to cancel the reservation because his wife got XXXX and asked if I could refund the rest. I sent the remaining {$2200.00} to XXXX XXXX via XXXX at email XXXX which was a XXXX account I think. Several days later, I got a letter in the mail from my bank, Bank of America, notifying me that the original check was fraudulent. I immediately called Bank of America to notify them of entirety of the fraud however, the funds could not be recovered from the XXXX accounts as the accounts had been closed. I feel like Bank of America had multiple opportunities to protect me during this and failed to do so. They should not have allowed me to initially deposit a fraudulent check, it, especially because this was a Bank of America check. Once they were unable to retrieve the funds from the check, they should have notified me in a more timely and urgent manner ( i.e. a phone call, email text message ) than through the mail, which would have prevented me from dispersing those funds through XXXX. Furthermore, one of the accounts that I send the fraudulent funds to was another Bank of America account which gave Bank of America ample opportunity to recognize the fraud/crime and intervene to protect me. I recently met with two agents from the Department of Homeland Security because XXXX XXXX was involved with another fraud case they were investigating and they said that Bank of America should have done more to protect me and should reimburse me the {$3900.00} I have lost.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
When I filed a second dispute of a charge-off that Ally Financial placed on my credit report, the company updated information in my credit file to alter the date that they first reported the charge-off illegally, in order to re-age the entry and sell it to a debt collector. 
I initially disputed the charge-off that Ally first reported in XXXX of XXXX as I was a victim of Hurricane Harvey in XXXX, TX. In XXXX of XXXX when my lease ended, Ally did not remove the fees that were supposed to be dismissed due to my status as a person affected by Hurricane Harvey. Ally began reporting charge-offs to my credit file from XX/XX/XXXX though XXXX of XXXX. When I filed a second dispute with the credit bureaus, in an attempt to raise my credit score, Ally then changed the information showing that the payments were current up until XX/XX/XXXX and reported a new charge-off starting in XX/XX/XXXX. I immediately received a call from a collection company about this disputed amount. It is clear the Ally fraudulently changed the information which was two years old, to falsely sell it to a collection company that it represented to collection company as a new charge-off.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
As the Consumer my rights have been violated multiple times. Due to my rights being violated as the Consumer I demand for any and all damages occurred to me the following {$1000.00} per violation as stated via 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance.

( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

The creditor has and is reporting my credit history inaccurately.

This has caused me as the Consumer Defamation and Financial Injury. I have disputed these items multiple times and both the Creditor and the Credit Reporting Agencies have failed to report it as a dispute which violates my rights under the FCRA as stated in section 623.

Creditors have pulled my Consumer file without my written permission or without reasons permissible under law which has caused injury to my credit report and scores. 
As stated in 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports. ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

On top of things the Credit Reporting Agencies and Creditor have " Re-Aged '' my account by reporting the date of last activity instead of the date of first delinquency. As a Consumer this has violated my right to Consumer Protection as afforded by the FCRA under Section 605 ( c ).

As a Consumer I have a right to privacy as stated in 15 U.S. Code 1681. There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy.

A primary purpose of the FCRA, is to protect consumers against inaccurate and incomplete credit reporting.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/21, I was shown and applied for an apartment at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Application ID : XXXX. I never received a notice of denial nor a specific reason for denial. Pursuant to The FCRA 615 ( b ) : " Whenever credit for personal, family, or household purposes involving a consumer is denied or the charge for such credit is increased either wholly or partly because of information obtained from a person other than a consumer reporting agency bearing upon the consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of 72 615 - 15 U.S.C. 1681m living, the user of such information shall, within a reasonable period of time, upon the consumers written request for the reasons for such adverse action received within sixty days after learning of such adverse action, disclose the nature of the information to the consumer. The user of such information shall clearly and accurately disclose to the consumer his right to make such written request at the time such adverse action is communicated to the consumer. '' At this time, I am exercising my right and I demand to know the specific reasons why I was denied tenancy for this apartment. The company 's negligence in providing me with this information has caused mental anguish as well as depletion of funding needed to pay for housing as they assessed an {$85.00} fee but failed to provide me with the details mentioned in this complaint.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Whom It May concern : I am writing to dispute a fraudulent charge on my account in the amount of {$2600.00}, {$23000.00}.

I am a victim of Identity theft, and I did not make or authorize this charge. I am requesting that the charge be removed, that any finance other charges related to the fraudulent amount be credited, as well and that I receive an accurate statement. This request is made pursuant to the Fair Credit Billing Acts amendments to the Truth in Lending Act, 15 U.S.C. 1666-1666b, 12 C.F.R 226.13. See Also 12 C.F.R 226.12 ( b ) I am writing to request the method of verification for dispute initiated on XX/XX/XXXX and the subsequent response received on XX/XX/XXXX enclosed with this letter. 
In accordance with FCRA, Section 611, I am requesting this information to review for completeness and accuracy and appropriateness. In lieu of sending the information you can reopen the dispute and ensure a proper investigation is performed.

I would appreciate a timely response outlining the steps that will occur to resolve this matter. If I do not receive a response I will have no choice but to exercise my right under FRCA, Section 616, and pursue legal action.

-- OPEN ACCOUNT 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX  with ACCT # XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX with a balance of {$2600.00} -This is not my account. 

-- PERSONAL ACCOUNT 2. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with ACCT # XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX with a balance of {$23000.00} -This is not my account.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify, through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract, any and all accounts that you post on a credit report. Otherwise anyone paying for credit bureaus reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. 
Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverifiable accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the account.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX CONVERGENT OUTSOURCING XXXX Your company have violated FCRA 615 ( f ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( f ) ) ( f ) Prohibition on sale or transfer of debt caused by identity theft You have not responded to my request to provide me with an investigation report. 
I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft. 
( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ). 
( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity. 
A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information. 
The reference items are listed below please take this matter very serious CONVERGENT OUTSOURCING XXXX I have report your company to consumerfinance.gov As a form of record and I am prepare to sue your company Example In re Portfolio Recovery Associates, LLC Telephone Consumer Protection Act Litigation, Case No. XXXX, in the U.S. District Court for the XXXX District of California Stop collection proceedings against me Signatures on applications and accounts Investigators report XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: I signed a year lease with my girlfriend in XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. Once we reached the end of the lease, I decided to move. She decided to stay in the home and signed a renewal directly with the property company. I never signed the document as I moved out ; however, the property management company allowed her to live there and sign just her name. She later broke the lease and XXXX XXXX now known as XXXX XXXX XXXX sent it to a collections agency and placed a negative mark on my credit requesting {$4500.00}. I've disputed this with XXXX  in XX/XX/XXXX, the collections agency ( Southwest Recovery ) in XX/XX/XXXX, and now recently directly with the property management company XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. This was clearly a bad business practice that their account manager, XXXX XXXX admits. She said the policy was changed as a result of many of these types of mishaps and they now require both signatures. According to Sec 94.053 both tenant and landlord must sign the lease and in Sec 94.055 it states if you they don't receive any communication from the tenant, then the renewal could be modified if the tenant remains on the property. Their renewal even states that the renewal must be signed by the tenant. If I was the tenant, then why was I not required to sign it? The Texas Property code doesnt say the property management has the right to renew a lease without the signature of the tenant but it does allow you to modify the renewal ( change rent, etc. )

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of 2017, I opened a checking account with XXXX XXXX XXXX. In XXXX of 2017, I deposited a check into the account that ended up being drawn on an account that had just been closed, although I did not know it. My account was immediately frozen. I called customer service, and they told me what had happened and suggested that I go speak to the manager of the bank branch where I had opened the account, who should be able to lift the freeze. 

When I went to the bank to see the manager, I was accompanied by my two granddaughters, who are XXXX. The manager stared at them, and it was obvious to me that because he was white, he was making a XXXX judgment on me ( I'm also white ) for having XXXX grandchildren. He was very rude to me and told me that because the deposit I made was returned, it caused several checks I had written to bounce. Although the account was not overdrawn, because I had bounced a check in the first 30 days, he said that bank had to close my account. The manager returned to me the money that was still in the account, and closed it during my visit. He assured me that there would be no negative reporting ramifications from the closure, as it was not my fault. 

Recently, I attempted to open an account with a different bank and was denied. I obtained a copy of my ChexSystems Report ( as recommended by the denying bank ) to see why I had been denied, and I noted that XXXX  XXXX XXXX had reported me to ChexSystems in 2017, indicating they had closed my account due to " suspected fraud ''. This is completely inaccurate. The ChexSystems report also indicated that I had an unpaid amount owed to XXXX as a result of the closed account, which is also inaccurate. 

I contacted XXXX several times to request that they remove the false information from ChexSystems, but the customer service reps I spoke with said they were unable to do so, but could not provide me any valid reason why ( as they agreed with me as to why my account had been closed and confirmed I did not owe XXXX any money ). 

The false and negative report by XXXX  XXXX XXXX to ChexSystems is preventing me from opening any bank accounts, which I need to do for my small business. I am being harmed severely every day that the false information remains on the report.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been disputing bankruptcies that EXPERIAN has been reporting on my consumer credit report since XX/XX/2020. I have sent them multiple letters disputing the alleged bankruptcies explaining why the item that they are reporting must be deleted from my consumer credit report. Each time they send me correspondence stating the item was verified-certified. No information on how the information was certified or verified. However, after reviewing my Experian Credit report, I discovered that Experian used a third-party data company. On XX/XX/2020, I sent Experian another certified dispute letter with supporting documentation. I received another letter from Experian stating that after their investigation, that it is verified-certified the item belongs to me. I have submitted a CFPB complaint on this item as well as others. In every letter, I have sent to them I have included a copy of my state driver 's license and a copy of my social security card. After receiving the response from Experian in regard, I sent another letter requesting the items be deleted and enclosed a copy of my social security card, ID with my name and correct address as proof of my identity. I received correspondence from Experian stating that once again the disputed item was verified-certified. I am convinced at this time, that either they are not conducting their investigation under the laws and guidelines set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) or they are blowing me off. Whichever it may be they are violating my rights under the laws of the FCRA and are knowingly reporting inaccurate information and participating in unethical reporting practices.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX CREDIT COLLECTION SERV XXXX Your company have violated FCRA 615 ( f ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( f ) ) ( f ) Prohibition on sale or transfer of debt caused by identity theft You have not responded to my request to provide me with an investigation report.

I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft.

( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ). 
( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity.

A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information. 
The reference items are listed below please take this matter very serious CREDIT COLLECTION SERV XXXX I have report your company to consumerfinance.gov As a form of record and I am prepare to sue your company Example In re Portfolio Recovery Associates, LLC Telephone Consumer Protection Act Litigation, Case No. XXXX, in the U.S. District Court for the XXXX District of California Stop collection proceedings against me Signatures on applications and accounts Investigators report XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020, I purchased a XXXX product from XXXX and then the funds were not added to the prepaid product. I paid XXXX for this transaction. The next day on XX/XX/2020 I called XXXX at XXXX and was told they would send a check for the balance on the card since that balance was not loaded. However at this time they were having " technical issues '' and was denied a refund of XXXX. I then called again at XXXX XXXX EST on XX/XX/2020 and spoke to XXXX - who told me I should seek that refund from XXXX and that is what the system is showing. XXXX refused me a refund in the morning since they were specifically told by XXXX that XXXX would provide the refund. I am out XXXX with no recourse at this time. Both XXXX and XXXX are denying a refund for a card I purchased. I was with XXXX on the phone as I filled this complaint. After further research the card is showing " refunded to store '' at XXXX at XXXX XXXX on the same day of purchase on XX/XX/2020. I DID NOT do this - this was clearly fraud. XXXX has no record of this transaction. I called back XXXX and tried to file a fruad complaint and was not able to open a billing dispute despite clearly stating in their terms and condition that this was a possibility. They stated that XXXX had my money. 

I attempted to file the complaint via the Barclays bank dispute process. I attached the response from the US Federal Reserve Bank of XXXX XXXX which stated in effect that XXXX was in possession of my money. Barclays stated they reviewed the letter but a letter from the US Federal Reserve was inadequate to reverse a decision in this matter. I am very frustrated with Barclays since this is clearly a fraudulent transaction and if a letter from the Fed is insufficient what level of evidence would be sufficient? 

I spoke to a manager at Barclays named XXXX, who stated that since this was a face to face transaction there was nothing they could - again despite a letter from US Fed ; I am having trouble understanding what gives Barclays the right to ignore the Federal Reserve. 

In the Federal Reserve Complaint it is stated, " XXXX XXXX concluded its investigation and determined that the gift card balance had already been refunded to XXXX Store # XXXX on XX/XX/2020. We confirmed that the funds have been reversed back to XXXX Store # XXXX, and that you will need to contact the store for resolution. '' In effect XXXX sold me a card, just reversed the funds on the card, kept the money and refused to provide me the refund. Someone or something forced this refund : If this isnt fraud I am not sure what is!

Somehow XXXX is stating I re-requested an active forbearance. This is inaccurate, XXXX XXXX advised I would need to make three payments to reinstate my loan prior to any modification. I began making payments in XX/XX/XXXX and through XX/XX/XXXX. In XXXX, I met the requirements for modification. XXXX dispatched a title company 30 days later on XXXX to sign paperwork. In XX/XX/XXXX I began calling XXXX XXXX, requesting an update after I noticed my XXXX payment was not applied to my mortgage and placed in a suspension account. I requested my credit report be updated. XXXX is reporting NR XXXX XXXX. I made payments in XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX. The reporting is making it appear I have not made any payments for 9 months ; furthermore l, have a hardship. My report also has a notation that I am making a partial payment agreement. I escalated to the XXXX XXXX Executive Team and have provided them 14 business days to correct the information. I would like the comments on my report updated to paying as agreed. I never paid partial payments. I deferred three payments to the end of my loan. In addition paid 8 additional payments since loan origination. Because I set up bi-weekly payments. I would also like the months I made payments to reflect those. 
It was my understanding the forbearance would not reflect poorly. If I new it would take 6 months to reinstate / modify my loan I would have repaid the suspended payments. This information was not discussed as we are all in uncharted times. I was working with my financial institution on a new loan and their underwriting flagged the non reporting mortgage payments.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
More than once I asked Experian to verify to me how they obtained the Bankruptcy information on my Credit Report when I asked them for their Method of Verification. Instead, Experian indicated to me that the Outcome Remains, by stating to me that the company that reported the information has certified to Experian that the information is accurate. Experian was able to tell me that the company certified the Bankruptcy as accurate on my Credit Report, but they also certified that they do not really know what company gave them the information by their Wording! Experian said that they MAY have obtained the Bankruptcy information through a third-party vendor, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
How can this Bankruptcy information be certified as accurate when you do not know where you actually obtained it from? When you say MAY HAVE, that indicates uncertainty, also Experian said that the information came from the Courts, I asked the Courts in a letter if they give out Bankruptcy information to third-parties, such as Credit Bureaus, XXXX etc. and the U.S. Bankruptcy Court sent me a letter back stating that they DO NOT PROVIDE INFORMATION TO ANY CREDIT REPORTING ANGENCY. All documentation has been uploaded and attached to this complaint for proof and verifying. 
The FCRA under Federal and State Law states, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of the furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. The FCRA requires the Credit Reporting Agencies to follow reasonable procedure to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report to a consumers Credit Report. Since Experian do not know where they obtained the Bankruptcy information and the Courts have confirmed that they do not provide Bankruptcy information to any third parties, such as Credit Reporting Agencies, this Bankruptcy is inaccurate and unverifiable and must be deleted!

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
This a company recently responded to my complaint stating that they knowingly reported false information to my credit report which I pointed it out I requested that it be removed and not updated but that also ignored the law I Pointed out here is the law d ) Consumer Report.

( 1 ) In general.The term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( 2 ) Exclusions.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( B ) any authorization or approval of a specific extension of credit directly or indirectly by the issuer of a credit card or similar device ; ( l ) The term credit card means any card, plate, coupon book or other credit device existing for the purpose of obtaining money, property, labor, or services on credit.

So since I paid for those items with my credit card it should not be reported on my credit report this is a violation 15 U.S. Code 1692g - Validation of debts ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector ; So you assumed this debt is valid even after you have stated that there are inaccuracies in the debt

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo is inaccurately and unfairly reporting to credit bureaus and causing further debt entrapment to their customers.

WF did not communicate limits to this and subsequently removed them from this status resulting in 30-60-90 day late reporting. Again, no limits had been communicated to me or my co-signer, despite me making an additional request in XXXX to extend. 

When I inquired when/why these changes places to place, it took speaking to the XXXX to get an answer that wasn't " you need to pay these to bring them current ... that's all we know '' and I waited an additional 15 days to be told they had no intention of acknowledging their lack of compassion, communication, or damage to my credit report. In addition to catching them rack fees in my account and being issued a refund for multiple instances of these fee assessments, I believe Wells Fargo is a predatory bank that should be investigated. 

They are resolving themselves of their place in the student debt crisis and selling their student loan accounts to a third party -- leaving thousands of us with loans nearly in default to instead deal with collection agencies where additional fees will be added. 

This is unfair, inaccurate, and it should be examined further to prevent Wells Fargo from further profiting from it's predation.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
THIS IS AN ADDENDUM/CORRECTION TO MY COMPLAINT # XXXX WHICH INDICATED THE WRONG SAVING ACCOUNT #. THE CORRECTED ACCOUNT NUMBER IS REFERENCED IN STEP # 4. 
IN ADDITION, XXXX POLICE REPORT/COMPLAINT # : XXXX was filed XX/XX/21. 
Citibank , N.A . failed to safeguard my funds in my Savings Plus account. My account was hacked on XX/XX/21 ( probably on XX/XX/21 ) as I was able to see the unauthorized ACH debit posted to an unknown account/person ( XXXX ) in the amount of {$19000.00}. 
I was shocked and immediately tried to report the fraud to Citibank and was sent to XXXX representative XXXX ID # : XXXX and explained what I saw and asked to report this as fraud/hacking. After several transfers and was unable to hear clearly I asked for a US representative in the Fraud department. I was told these funds were completely gone and the ACH transferred without any red flag alert, security check or confirmation that this large transfer was never my habit in 39 years of banking with Citibank. They did not transfer money in increments, but in less than overnight-they fully completed this fraudulent transaction. I was asked if I wanted to dispute and then assigned CASE ID # : XXXX. 
It has been my clear pattern and habit to transfer any funds from savings into checking before executing an ACH Debit. They said all that was needed to execute this fraud was my name, routing number and account number. This was very alarming, but they did not seem to want to expedite this matter until I asked to speak to a supervisor. Supervisor XXXX ID # : XXXX then expedited this to Citibank 's PECS Department which is internal, back office and I am not able to contact them directly. I have still not been given provisional credit or return of my funds and they only will say their investigation is " ongoing '' while I can not use my funds which I need now very much.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have been disputing bankruptcies that XXXX  has been reporting on my consumer credit report since XX/XX/2020. Each time they send me correspondence stating the item was verified-certified. No information on how the information was certified or verified. However, after reviewing my XXXX  Credit report, I discovered that XXXX used a third-party data company. On XX/XX/2020, I sent XXXX  another certified dispute letter with supporting documentation. I received another letter from XXXX  stating that after their investigation, that it is verified-certified the item belongs to me. I have submitted a CFPB complaint on this item as well as others. In every letter, I have sent to them I have included a copy of my state driver 's license and a copy of my social security card. After receiving the response from XXXX  in regard, I sent another letter requesting the items be deleted and enclosed a copy of my social security card, ID with my name and correct address as proof of my identity. I received correspondence from XXXX  stating that once again the disputed item was verified-certified. I am convinced at this time, that either they are not conducting their investigation under the laws and guidelines set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) or they are blowing me off. Whichever it may be they are violating my rights under the laws of the FCRA and are knowingly reporting inaccurate information and participating in unethical reporting practices.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The account information was disputed based on Date of delinquency, Date of last payment, Date last active which by XXXX does not match. I disputed the information with XXXX and Transunion and the investigation by XXXX came back to the credit bureaus that the account information is accurate. I live in CALIFORNIA and this information is inconsistent under the CCRAA. 

FCRA 623 and FDCPA 806 ( b ) Maximum Possible Accuracy state that the creditor MUST enter a notice of dispute.If this is not entered the account can not report on the account XXXX p. 2-2 Industry Reporting Standards '' All accounts must be reported on a monthly basis. '' The creditor XXXX did not update the account status as " disputed '' while I was shopping for a new home at which time I was denied a mortgage loan. 

FDCPA 809. Validation of debts ( b ) Disputed debts If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) of this section that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector. Collection activities and communications that do not otherwise violate this subchapter may continue during the 30-day period referred to in subsection ( a ) unless the consumer has notified the debt collector in writing that the debt, or any portion of the debt, is disputed or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor. Any collection activities and communication during the 30-day period may not overshadow or be inconsistent with the disclosure of the consumers right to dispute the debt or request the name and address of the original creditor. 

This account should no longer be reporting because of the violation of my consumer rights under the CCRAA and the Rosenthal FDCPA

Agents told me that many people didn't put in offers because the garage that is located near the property did not come with the house. The mortgage never included the garage located near the property but, as of XX/XX/XXXX, there was a survey completed showing that the garage is actually part of the property. The garage was never insured and only used 1 stall of the garage being that the other stall was used by the owner of other property, and believed to be owned by the owner of other nearby property that shares driveway next to the property. The power is connected to the other property. The garage was never included on the mortgage or appraisal for the mortgage. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX did not work with me or provide accurate information regarding workout options which have resulted in foreclosure on my credit report and preventing me from getting another home for me and my family.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo is inaccurately and unfairly reporting to credit bureaus and causing further debt entrapment to their customers. 

During the lockdown, I requested my loans be entered into a forbearance XXXX and I entered again from XXXX. XXXX did not communicate limits to this and subsequently removed them from this status resulting in 30-60-90 day late reporting. Again, no limits had been communicated to me or my co-signer, despite me making an additional request in XXXX to extend. 

When I inquired when/why these changes places to place, it took speaking to the XXXX to get an answer that wasn't " you need to pay these to bring them current ... that's all we know '' and I waited an additional 15 days to be told they had no intention of acknowledging their lack of compassion, communication, or damage to my credit report. In addition to catching them rack fees in my account and being issued a refund for multiple instances of these fee assessments, I believe Wells Fargo is a predatory bank that should be investigated. 

They are resolving themselves of their place in the student debt crisis and selling their student loan accounts to a third party -- leaving thousands of us with loans nearly in default to instead deal with collection agencies where additional fees will be added. 

This is unfair, inaccurate, and it should be examined further to prevent Wells Fargo from further profiting from it's predation.

Product: Debt collection

Why don't you take the steps and submit the documents that you keep refusing to send verifying the debt is mine. It would be a lot easier for you to provide those documents than me going and claiming identity theft three years later. Otherwise, stop updating my credit reports every month with XXXX. You have my information so you can send me the medical records from the date of service you have on there. Because I have not been to any emergency room.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX I returned a XXXX XXXX XXXX as instructed by XXXX. XXXX had performed a preinspection and noted several minor repairs I should have completed before turn-in. I followed their direction and left all the documentation in the car front seat. XXXX still charged me for all the repairs. After several phone calls and multiple resubmissions of the documented receipts and pictures, XXXX finally removed most of the charges. I paid the lease termination fee of {$300.00} and a lost key for {$250.00} but XXXX continued to send me invoices each month. As you can see in the attached Experian report the balance changed almost monthly for no apparent reason or without any clear itemization. 

Finally, XXXX claimed that the roughly {$390.00} was for personal property tax. Since the State of VA prorates I ask XXXX to send me a statement of the tax record. They didn't send anything other than non-informational monthly statements. recently my credit score took a big hit 100+ points. After investigating I found that XXXX had charged off {$2800.00} dollars. 

I have escalated this to a supervisor who claims there is nothing they can do, I ask the supervisor who would not provide his name or case/claim number. I ask for the supervisor I was speaking with for the 3rd time and he said " she '' would call me. I have received no call. 

I ask XXXX to update the credit bureaus with the status of the account has been paid in full. XXXX agrees it's been paid in full but refuses to report this to the bureaus or have the {$2800.00} charge off. 

This was a 3-year lease. Not a single payment was ever late. 

Hoping you can help me. I have Federal Government clearances and that charge off could prevent me from obtaining future clearances to provide assistance to our Federal clients. I explained the serious nature of this to XXXX they didn't seem to care. Thank you for any help you can provide.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX has incorrectly reported three ( 3 ) 90-day late payments on my credit report during a federally mandated suspension of all student loan repayments. When I contacted them to correct this error in their reporting, they refused to correct it. 

According to Section 3513 ( d ) of the CARES Act ( Public Law 116-136 ), federal student loan repayment suspensions were supposed to be reported to consumer reporting agencies positively ( i.e., as if the borrower has been making regular payments. In relevant part subsection ( d ) reads : During the period in which the Secretary suspends payments on a loan under subsection ( a ), the Secretary shall ensure that, for the purpose of reporting information about the loan to a consumer reporting agency, any payment that has been suspended is treated as if it were a regularly scheduled payment made by a borrower. 

CARES Act suspension of federal student loan repayment was extended until XX/XX/2021. 

XXXX has completely disregarded federal law and has ruined my credit. Given that they have made this fatal error in their reporting, I am respectfully requesting that this error be corrected and XXXX reflect the appropriate positive payment history.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have become aware that that the credit reporting agencies may not be in compliance with certain provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and how it is reporting my credit information.

In accordance of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 605. Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports [ 15 U.S.C. 1681c ] ( a ) Information exclu
ded from consumer reports. Except as authorized under subsection ( b ) of this section, no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : ( 1 ) Cases under title 11 [ United States Code ] or under the Bankruptcy Act that, from the date of entry of the order for relief or the date of adjudication, as the case may be, antedate the report by more than 10 years.

604. Permissible purposes of consumer reports [ 15 U.S.C. 1681b ] ( a ) In general. Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, or a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury.

( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

With subsections 604 and 605, the credit reporting agencies did not get the information of my bankruptcy from the State of Tennessee nor did I express that information to be made public in any expressed written agreement or statement. The three credit reporting agencies received my personal credit information from public records which they are not in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Fair Credit Reporting Act states the regulation and laws that govern the three credit reporting agencies, however the misuse of personal information for financial gain harms consumers. I could not find a place to stay because that was on my credit report and reduce my score. I find it very difficult that I can not find a place to call home in a reasonable area do to the inconvenience of the misuse of my personal credit information.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I called Wells Fargo to request a downgrade of my wells Fargo propel card as I was no longer interested in paying the {$170.00} annual fee. I didn't think the fee justified the cards benefit. The representative presented various credit cards I could downgrade to that did not have an annual fee. After a 90-minute conversation, I decided to downgrade to the lower tier of the propel card that did not the annual key. I also allowed the representative to charge my checking account for the annual fee of {$170.00} in case the downgrade process takes long in order to avoid being charge a late fee since the annual fee was due. The representative ensured me everything be process and I will receive the new card in a few weeks. 

In the first half of XXXX, I spent a lot of times traveling which was extended due to the pandemic. I was in the west coast until XX/XX/XXXX. When I returned home in XXXX, I found several letters from wells Fargo stating that I owed them {$170.00} plus late fees/interest. Also, my credit report was flagged for missed payment. At first, I was confused and thought maybe someone stole the new card while I was away and used it. Because I know that I didn't owe wells Fargo anything especially since I paid them the {$170.00} annual fee back in XXXX to avoid any issues relating to downgrading my card. 

After having several conversations with wells Fargo bank tellers and two Case Specialist in the Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, they confirmed that the representative did not downgrade the card as he ensured me, he will do. Furthermore, they confirmed that they did receive my payment for the annual fee back in XXXX but failed to update my account with the new balance ( which was {$0.00} ) which resulted in them reporting me to the credit bureau. To explain, Wells Fargo continued to charge me for the annual fee even though I had already paid them the fee. Every month from XXXX to XXXX they reported a missed payment to all three credit bureaus. They apologized for their mistake and ensure me that they will contact the credit bureau to remove all the negative marks they put on my account as this was their negligence for not verifying their information about my account. It is now XX/XX/XXXX ( I spoke to them XXXX XXXX ) and the missed payment has not been removed. I also open a dispute with XXXX and XXXX said they refuse to remove it. It seems like the only thing left to do is to take them to court because they are violating the federal fair credit reporting act ( FCRA ) and has damaged my creditworthiness.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have contacted Experian a total of three times to dispute inaccurate reporting on my credit report by my student loan servicer. 

The dates I have contacted Experian to file a dispute are : XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

The disputes in XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX were initiated by me through the Experian XXXX app. The XX/XX/XXXX dispute was taken over the phone by a dispute specialist. 

Each of the three disputes have consistently presented the same narrative : my account is being reported as 90 days late during a period of Income Based Repayment with a payment amount of {$0.00} due. 

I have submitted statements to Experian as part of the XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX disputes which reflect that no payment was due during the alleged 90-day delinquency in XX/XX/XXXX. 

I was unable to upload new evidence to the Experian consumer upload site because the files were too big on the first attempt. This caused the website to display an error message on further attempted uploads and also for any other sessions. 

The results from all of my disputes return with no change being made. The reason is because my student loan servicer has certified to Experian that the information is correct and as a result would remain. 

This is a boilerplate response and I do not feel that individual human attention has been given to my dispute. If that were the case, Experian could clearly see that it is not possible for my student loan account to be delinquent when no payment has been due multiple years prior to and after XX/XX/XXXX. 


I am aware of my rights if I disagree with the results. However, the remedies that are listed on my report are not available. I can not submit a statement of disagreement to be listed on my report nor have I been able to obtain the method and details of how the investigation was conducted. 

This is the ONLY delinquency on my report and as a result, my score and credit file are suffering. This impedes my ability to obtain credit which is causing me to suffer a loss. 

Experian should stop acting in favor of the student loan servicer and instead conduct investigation in a neutral format as they are legally obligated to do.
