Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
A letter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau I pay a Mortgage to Wells Fargo bank. 
When the pandemic started Last XXXX. I was not having a problem with making my mortgage payments. But in XXXX the first part of XXXX. I was informed by Wells Fargo that i could enter into a forbearance program. That my missed payments could be deferred until the end of my regular Mortgage period. I was also told If I did not want My mortgage payments to increase. that i could pay an extra amount to the escrow So that my payment would not increase. So i started paying at least {$650.00} a month. In total i have sent {$4300.00} to the Escrow department at Wells Fargo. My regular payment was {$1300.00}. 
Now in XXXX I informed them that i would try to resume paying my mortgage. I am a retired XXXX XXXX. So i really don't have a full time job. So I am making it with the amount I regularly pay. But i could do better if the payment was a little lower. 
But I was just informed that my new payment would be {$1600.00} I am devastated to hear that even though I have paid about {$4300.00} in to escrow that my payment increases Anyway. as If i had paid nothing. My mortgage is an FHA loan., And i Tried to do what was right.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative: When I leased my vehicle I signed a contract for XXXX per year and at the end of my lease I was billed for XXXX per year so instead of owing XXXX XXXX I owed XXXX XXXX but my contract said I signed to pay for XXXX per year ... after looking over my contract I noticed that I have two copies one that says dealers copy and one that says leasees copy, none of the numbers match!!! I told the dealership this, they blew me off I told the titling company this and they said there was nothing they could do because they were just using the contract that XXXX XXXX XXXX had submitted to them. I showed my new dealership and they suggested I get a lawyer because the contract was messed up!! I never once missed a payment with them before and the lawyer that I had spoke to told me to try to negotiate with the company first. So even though the company had been XXXX XXXX, and very inconvenient over the phone and email, I decided it was best for me to drive there, even though its 2hours for me to get there ... I spoke with XXXX XXXX, and a guy named XXXX, and asked that someone from fianc would be available and if I would be able to see XXXX XXXX They both had said yes, and so at the start of COVID I drove out there to clear this up. The guy went in circles claiming the contract was clear as day but then claiming it make no sense that the numbers did not match on both copies, then told me I should not even have a copy of the dealers copy, I said why so I wouldnt know you were trying to get over on me?!? He then asked to have the copy and told me there wasnt anything I could do, I told him I wanted to speak to the XXXX he said he was the head of finance, and that he was sorry that I wasted my time driving out there. I told him I wasnt leaving until I talked to XXXX XXXX, and he said sorry he just left!! Then because of COVID my lawyer was not getting back to me! And I thought because of the pandemic it could have been postponed because I never once received a phone call or letter about the money after XXXX! Then when I called the titling company to make a payment I was told my account was closed. I thought maybe they had figured it out! Then I went to buy my house only to find they put it in as a charge off dropouts my credit over XXXX points!! This is ridiculous for me to be punished for their mistake, and I dont just have {$4.00} extra grand to pay a car company that filed paperwork wrong!! I had a credit score in the XXXX before and this disheartening especially in these times!

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: My complaint involves Bank of America reporting a closed savings or checking account ( I believe ) for suspected fraud activity although I have reported to them that this account is not mine and must be the result of ID theft. When I found out about this reporting I alerted XXXX  via online dispute and Bank of America sent a one page internal screenshot of a form with my name typed into it. So XXXX  marked as verified although I am not sure how that verified anything. Subsequently, I called Bank of America and after several hours I finally got to report the account as fraudulent and I was sent a Uniform ID Theft form to be filled out, signed, and returned with a copy of my ID ; which I did. A couple of weeks later I receive a letter from Bank of America saying that no ID theft was detected and this blemish remains on my consumer reports ( i.e. XXXX, XXXX, etc. ) although Bank of America has amended to include SETTLED IN FULL in the Closure Status line. How is this legal, moral, just, or ethical? Bank of America has yet to tell me why this was even suspected of fraudulent activity. All I have received from them is that one page mentioned earlier. Nothing that I signed, no real account info, nor any kind of insight into why they are refusing to remove this against proper procedure and various consumer protection laws. I have been forced to postpone the opening of a law practice and other business ventures due to this incorrect and fraudulent reporting. I can not obtain a proper business bank account and take advantage of business banking offers, etc. Moreover ( and more importantly ), I have no chance at being able to open an XXXX account for my law practice, thus costing me substantially. Not to mention as an attorney and seeking employment, having a suspected fraud negatively reporting on my consumer reports is long dead end road that I did not even know I was on. I have even sent Bank of America a verification page that my info/data was stolen in the XXXX Data Breach of 2017 among other numerous data breaches. This account is not, was not, and will never be mine. I don't know what else to do to get Bank of America to understand this. It seems to be some one of those internally started accounts probably for some promo for sales people or something. I DON'T KNOW! ALL I DO KNOW IS I ( THE PERSON THEY ARE NEGATIVELY REPORTING IT AGAINST ) HAD NOR HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH IT AND IT'S NOT RIGHT THAT THIS BIG BANK WHO GLADLY RECEIVED OUR BAILOUT FUNDS CAN NOT HAVE PROPER PROCEDURES IN PLACE TO ENSURE THESE THINGS DON'T HAPPEN AND WHEN THEY DO MAKE SURE THEY ARE NIPPED IN THE BUD AND NOT AFFECTING THE LIVES OF EVERYDAY PEOPLE JUST TRYING TO MAKE IT. IT'S DISGRACEFUL, DISGUSTING, SHAMEFUL, AND UNJUST

Consumer complaint narrative: I received notification that a collect account was reporting to my credit report from an account I have no knowledge of. I spoke to the original creditor who asked that I submit a fraud complaint form and I would receive resolution. I requested a signed original contract as well as any and all validation they have to prove this is my account and NOT a result of fraud. I have since proved to the CRA 's that the " public information '' is inaccurate and it has been removed from my file ( i.e. address ). The collection agency was able to provide me information regarding the debt by locating the account using my SSN. They provided me with the Account number which has lead me no where with the Original Creditor. When speaking to the original creditor, I have been advised they ( the front line representative ) is unable to discuss the account without the account passcode. I informed them seeing as how the account was established without my authorization, I do not have that information. I have been unable to receive resolution from either the original creditor nor the collection agency that is reporting this debt.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I received a copy of my credit report and noticed there was some information on my report that is inaccurate. I am in the process of buying a home and the information that is being shown is holding up the process. According to the provisions of the Fair Credit ReportingAct 611 ( a ) [ 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ], these disputed items must be reinvestigated or deleted from my credit record within 30 days. During the investigation period, the item I am disputing must be removed from my credit report as the mere reporting of items prior to debt validation constitutes collection activity. I am also requesting my name, address, and telephone number updated and remove any other names, addresses, and telephone numbers that do not belong to me. The following account in dispute is listed below : XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. My current address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, OH. XXXX. Please notify me that the above items have been deleted pursuant to 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) [ 15USC1681j ( a ) ( 6 ). I am also requesting an updated copy of my credit report, which should be sent to the address listed below. According to the provisions of 612 [ 15 USC 1681j ], there should be no charge for this report.

Product: Mortgage

XX/XX/XXXX : Applied for and was approved for refinance from Amerisave ( NMLS # XXXX ) ; paid {$500.00} application fee.

XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX : Didn't hear anything from lender, no returns of calls/emails. 
XX/XX/XXXX : A processor reached out to ( ultimately ) set up a closing date of XXXX XXXX. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Closing appointment canceled with an hour 's notice given to me. XX/XX/XXXX : Closing appointment canceled without any notice given -- I had to call signing agent because I thought he was late and he told me the documents weren't ready. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Wired {$3400.00} to XXXX XXXX for closing costs. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Closing appointment was canceled with an hour 's notice given to me.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
My wife and I chose Wells Fargo because they were able to match a great rate to refinance my home mortgage. They are also the current holder of my home mortgage. Throughout the process, I was told repeatedly that the " Other Costs '' associated with my refinance would be waived ( {$0.00} ) because I am already a Wells Fargo customer. This gave them a significant edge over the other lender quotes I received. I received this correspondence multiple times throughout this refinance process ( XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ). 

Well, it is now time to close ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and those fees are still there. I am now out an appraisal fee and 3 months of correspondence. I have made it known that I will not be going through with the refinance if those fees are included on my loan since the beginning, so this should not be a surprise to anyone I have talked to at Wells Fargo. I am receiving the response of " There is nothing we can do '', which is just not good enough for me. I should not be penalized for incorrect information. I will continue to go through the appropriate channels until I receive and adequate solution.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
My checking account with M & T bank has been compromised by XXXX twice in less than three months. It started on XX/XX/XXXX for {$.00}, {$1.00}, and {$19.00}. I was able to report and to leave email telling them to remove the charges but I was upset because M & T had nothing on its menu or online to report fraud. 

On XX/XX/XXXX an XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX hit my account for {$.00} and {$3.00}. Again I tried to contact M & T to no avail. Because Covid, reaching customer Service was impossible. I spent hours trying to reach them for over a week! I tried continuously and was really upset because my social security check is deposited in this same checking account! 
Finally, I called my local branch and a one of the female employee returned my call and resolved the issues. I told her what had happened. 
I received my stimulus check direct deposited into this same account. The check for {$600.00} I never received. I went to the IRS website and saw that I qualified. One suggestion on the IRS website said to ask your bank if they.received the funds. 
No answer. 
My mother who is XXXX also has an account with M & T. She wrote a check to a charity in XX/XX/XXXX. It was cashed later at XXXX XXXX XXXX and changed from {$100.00} to {$7600.00} in XXXX. M & T told use because it was check fraud, it would take 90 days to return her funds. When we called back in 90 days, M & T stated their investigator was on vacation and it would be handles upon his return. Nothing happened. No money went back into my Mom 's account. 
Last week, an investigator from XXXX XXXX called and asked us about the case. M & T had lied to us. They had never done an investigation!! In two days, my mom had her money back. since XX/XX/XXXX!!!! 
Something is going on. Senor citizens are being targeted! My mom had a similar problem with XXXX XXXX XXXX for alot less money. 
I am XXXX and my mom is XXXX.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: Continued phone calls from Superfleet collections with the intent to harass and annoy and to tie up phone line. They call from XXXX. They called yesterday and I provided payment information to 4 different people yesterday. The last person I spoke with yesterday told me the account would be noted and that the calls would stop. Today when they first called, I explained that I had spoken with them 4 times yesterday, and provided them the payment information 4 separate times. I asked for them to cease and desist calling. The lady laughed at me and said the calls would continue and she hung up on me. I called the number back and asked to speak with a supervisor and a gentleman refused, spoke over me, and said they would continue to call until the payment was received. I have received five phone calls today from XXXX - XXXX XXXX. One time they actually called using two different lines at the SAME time. I then called the XXXX number to file a complaint. I spoke with a supervisor at Superfleet and then also to the cancellation department ( account was supposed to have already been cancelled ). The cancellation department ( XXXX XXXX ) informed us that they were aware of NATIONWIDE mail delays from the United States Post Office and this was happening all over. However, they continue to harass and charge exhorbitant late fees to their customers - even customers like us that have NEVER been late on a payment and pay their account in full each and every month. We asked them to ensure that the calls do not continue.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Specialized Loan Servicing purchased my equity line of credit XXXX {$60000.00} limit ) from XXXX XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX, The balance was in or around {$54000.00}. In XXXX XXXX XXXX or so XXXX the account reached its draw down limit {$60000.00}. I was not able to make but one payment in XXXX the rest of the payments were applied to the balance on the account. A bill collector on behalf of SLS contacted me in early XX/XX/XXXX about the account. I contacted SLS and sought a forbearance agreement. It was granted and they sent me a letter confirming that I was in forbearance for the period XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, and all foreclosure activity would cease. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, my usual statement listed attorney 's fees, other foreclosure expenses and my house was listed with XXXX XXXX GA for public auction for XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted SLS at their customer service number and was told that something was wrong because I was in a forbearance agreement. I emailed the bill collector - attorney and explained that I was in forbearance. I wrote the first letter of many to SLS who did nothing but canceled the sale for that date. I complained about them billing me for foreclosure expenses while under the forbearance agreement. In my next statement the legal fees associated with foreclosure were changed to " corporate advances '' XXXX same amount for each item that was billed in the XX/XX/XXXX statement, and designated as foreclosure activity ). I wrote an overnight letter requesting a full disclosure of what the fees were and under what authority were they placing these corporate advancement fees on my account. The payment department in XXXX XXXX CO sent the letter back to me and told me that their billing office in XXXX CO handled account issues. I sent a copy of the letter to them, and as of today, I have heard nothing. On XX/XX/XXXX paid the reinstatement amount which included the corporate advances now billed as " fees billed '' with no explanation.

Payoff statement dated XX/XX/2021, with a payoff amount of {$4000.00}. I requested an update to my credit reports to reflect the paid off mortgage loan. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have two CitiCards. An Awards ( ... XXXX ) card and a CitiAdvantage Card ( ... XXXX ) Sometime in early 2020, before XXXX, my card ending in XXXX, that I had not used for over 5 years was paid off complete. 

Payments were being made automatically to both accounts from my XXXX XXXX Checking Account. For some reason after the paying off my card ending in XXXX, my payments to card XXXX ( CitiAdvantage ) were being applied to my XXXX card. I discovered this error and contacted Citi, who promised to move the credit in XXXX to XXXX and update my payment history accordingly. Citi moved the credit to XXXX on XX/XX/2020, or thereabouts, but never updated my payment history as promised. As a result I immediately received a 60-90 past due on my credit report, which I did not know of until recently. 

Furthermore, my card ending in XXXX had received activity that was fraudulent after the XXXX correction. I never received a statement or notification in the mail about any activity. The disputed amount was reported to the credit agencies as still past due as recently as XX/XX/2021, however upon notifying Citi, their fraud department and customer service departments tell me that I have a negative {$35.00} balance ( credit ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received two letters from Citi ( attached ) stating that my credit information is correct and that I need to contact the credit agencies to let them know I'm disputing the information. 

I spoke with Citi again, XXXX - XXXX PST on XX/XX/2021 and was sent from department to department speaking to representatives in their fraud and customer services department only to be disconnected without resolution. 

I fear this really indicates Citi 's lack of security protocols and their inability to have any oversight to their credit card billing and management systems. Their lack of knowledge about their own processes is grossly expressed as their representatives appear to be mouthpieces to only drive their customers to give up due to their corporate direction of not really caring about their clients concerns. I am sure that I am not the only one going through this exhaustive process to right the wrong due to their negligence. 

I hope this is enough information to start this investigation. 

I plan on re-calling them as soon as send out this statement. 

All of the above can be confirmed if Citi releases all phone recordings and transcripts of my discussions and actions with them since XX/XX/2020. 

I can offer a copy of my credit report if needed. Every other creditor reports exceptional payment history except Citi. 

Best Regards ... ... ..

XX/XX/XXXX - I called your customer service line and spoke with XXXX who transferred me to the supervisor XXXX. I was told me request for PMI removal would be escalated. 

Since then I have called seven more times ( XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX again and XX/XX/XXXX ). I have spoken with 11 different people ( XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX- supervisor, XXXX , XXXX- Supervisor, XXXX XXXX , XXXX XXXX , XXXX, XXXX- supervisor , XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX ) to find out why my PMI request on XX/XX/XXXX had not been addressed. All 11 of those people stated they would either call me or email me back, and the only one that did is XXXX XXXX who called me back once to tell me she did not have an update for me. 

I paid my loan down to the amount you requested, well within the time frame you asked me to pay it down within, and I submitted a request in writing ( as shown below ) also well within that requested timeframe. Please tell me why I need to pay for another vacation.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I recently, submitted a dispute to XXXX  about the way Jared-Galleria Jewelry is reporting on my credit report. On, XX/XX/XXXX, I received a response back from XXXX stating that Jared-Galleria Jewelry has CERTIFIED AND VERIFIED the information to be " Accurately '' reporting. I'm confused as to how this account could be VERIFIED AND CERTIFIED TO BE ACCURATE when there are several errors in the way this is being reported : 1 ) XXXX reports that this account was closed " XX/XX/XXXX '' this is totally a contradiction to how it is being reported in the " Payment History/Rating ''. Payment History clearly shows that this account was open in XXXX and did not close until the latter of XXXX. Secondly, XXXX reports that the " High balance '' on this account is {$1400.00}. This totally confuses even the most expert because the credit limit is {$1500.00}. How could the Highest balance be lower then the credit limit? Next, XXXX  fails report the Date of First Delinquency which is required because it helps to identify the purge date. This all leads me to believe that XXXX  did not conduct a reasonable independent investigation. Using XXXX or parroting what a creditor says is not satisfactory for an independent investigation.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Until recently, my home loan has been serviced by XXXX XXXX. A letter apparently bearing a date of XX/XX/2021, and a signature of " XXXX XXXXExecutive Vice President/Head of Mortgage Operations/Loan Care, LLC '' purports to inform me that servicing of the loan will transfer to LoanCare , LLC, and states : 1. " Beginning XX/XX/2021, your home loan will transfer to LoanCare. '' 2. " If you have any questions about this transfer for either XXXX XXXX  or LoanCare, please don't hesitate to contact us. '' and goes on to list a telephone number and partial web site address for LoanCare. 

3. " Should you have questions, please reach out to [ ... ] LoanCare on or after XX/XX/2021. '' On XX/XX/2021, I attempted to contact LoanCare by telephone at the telephone number provided in the XXXX letter of XX/XX/2021, to ask questions about the transfer. LoanCare 's automated telephone system played numerous recorded messages, but offered no way to reach a customer service agent. Moreover, LoanCare 's automated telephone system mentioned a date of XX/XX/2021 on which information about my account would be available by telephone and via online access. This date is different from the date mentioned in the XXXX letter of XX/XX/2021. 

On XX/XX/2021, I attempted to access LoanCare 's web site at the address furnished in the XXXX letter of XX/XX/2021. When I sought to create an account, LoanCare 's web site did not appear to recognize my Social Security number, which is the Social Security number associated with the loan by the previous servicer, XXXX XXXX. However, another part of LoanCare  's web site appeared to recognize the loan number assigned by XXXX XXXX, along with a fragment of my Social Security number, and informed me that information about my loan would be available on XX/XX/2021. This date is different from both the date mentioned by LoanCare 's automated telephone system on which information about my account was to be available, and the date after which the XXXX letter of XX/XX/2021 instructed me that inquiries about the loan should be made to LoanCare and invited such inquires.

Consumer complaint narrative: I had to file bankruptcy in XX/XX/XXXX  2020 due to income reduction. There were several credit card accounts that I had paid the balances in full prior to the filing. I feel the remarks referencing " bankruptcy '' should be removed on these accounts and the accounts be moved to the Satisfactory Accounts list in my report. I had added a Consumer Statement to my Credit Report stating the fact that these accounts were paid off. No one is going to see this statement.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My rights under the FCRA are being violated. Not only are these accounts not mine. I have not supplied proof under the doctrine of estopple by silence Englehardt v. Gravens ( Mo ) 281 SW 715, 719, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. Not only that but section 15 UCS 1681 ( 2 ) excludes the reporting of the transactions with corporations.

as my right under federal law.

Under 15 USC 1681 ( a ) congress defines a consumer report as the term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for.. 
Understand that by this law, XXXX is included because you provide this consumer report and you are a consumer reporting agency! Under 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ), it also mentions exclusions pertaining to consumer reporting. I am quoting directly from congress so understand that your reporting is a federal violation based on laws put in place by congress.

15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) i excludes the reporting of report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report. 
The term person means any individual, partnership, corporation, trust, estate, cooperative, association, government or governmental subdivision or agency, or other entity. 
All of the companies listed below are CORPORATIONS as defined by congress as a person Therefore the transactions between the consumer ( me ) and these corporations should not be on my consumer report under FEDERAL LAW! You are in direct breach of the federal laws put in place to protect the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice for Proof of Claim Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX Service # XXXX To Whom it may Concern : This is a this complaint is submitted Under OHIO LAW U.C.C 1319.12 Taking assignment of debts States ( C ) No collection agency shall commence litigation for the collection of an assigned account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness unless it has taken the assignment in accordance with all of the following requirements : Credit contracts are non-assignable even if the contract has a clause for assignability because it violates the contract Law. Where there is no fair valuable consideration given, the contract or agreement is void ab inito. The debt is non-transferable. If it is a contract for credit or goes to the character of the parties, it can not be transferred or assigned. No state can make a law impairing contracts, Under OHIO LAW U.C.C 1319.12 Taking assignment of debts ( 3 ) The assignment was manifested by a written agreement separate from and in addition to any document intended for the purpose of listing the account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness with the collection agency. The written agreement shall state the effective date of the assignment and the consideration paid or given, if any, for the assignment and shall expressly authorize the collection agency to refer the assigned account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness to an attorney admitted to the practice of law in this state for the commencement of litigation. The written agreement also shall disclose that the collection agency may consolidate, for purposes of filing an action, the assigned account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness with those of other creditors against an individual debtor or co-debtors. 
Dartmouth College v. Woodward 4 Wheat 518 : White v. Hart, 13 Id 646. Once the Creditor writes off a debt, it can not be assigned or Collected. Since this is an error I demand that you send me the following proofs. As you are obligated to do in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practice Act. Section 1692 ( g ) : Under the Law, FDCPA, Section 1692 ( g ), you have 30 days to supply these proofs, if more time is needed please contact me by certified mail and I will extend you 15 extra days. I also request to see a certified copy of any contract or agreement between you and the original creditor that gave you the right to collect this debt.

Also, to have it removed or deleted the representative told me that it was something that was available upon request which I did request However, only to find out that this has not been removed or deleted from my credit. The last report showed that it was indeed paid in full but also as an active account which is not the truth. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
There was an inquiry on my XXXX  credit report from XX/XX/2020, that was a result of identity theft. I discovered this during a review of my credit report. I called XXXX and they told me to contact the reporting company. I immediately put a freeze on my credit reports. I called Credco who made the inquiry and was told that the inquiry was from XXXX XXXX. I spoke to the dealership manager who told me about the applicant who applied for the credit. I verified my information and proved it was not me who applied for the credit. I spoke to Credco and was told to file a police report and a report with Identitytheft.gov. I did both of these and emailed them the reports asking them to remove the inquiry from my credit report. 

When I spoke to XXXX at Credco today, she told me that they now require me to send them a copy of my social security number, my driver 's license, and a copy of a utility bill. I told her that they never requested that information before and asked her if I sent them the additional documents if they would immediately remove the inquiry from my report and she was not able to guarantee me that they would. I told her that the information they are requesting is very sensitive and I do not feel comfortable releasing this information to a company that has not been authorized to receive this information and they could use it to further steal my identity now that they have a copy of my social security card, driver 's license, and utility bill. How can I be sure that they are not part of the identity theft scam? 

In essence, I told her that they are re-victimizing me by refusing to remove a fraudulent inquiry in spite of proof from a police report which they requested.

On XX/XX/2019, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX add a hard inquiry on my credit reports. 
On XX/XX/2019, XXXX XXXX XXXX add a hard inquiry on my credit reports. 
On XX/XX/2019, CREDCO add a hard inquiry on my credit reports. 
But companies did not provide the following proof : Permissible Purpose My written authorization Proof that I personally initiated these inquiries.

According to the fair credit reporting act I ask this account be deleted and completely removed off my credit report immediately.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2021, we completed the closing signing of legal documents on the refinancing of our mortgage to a lower rate. Before we started the signing, we gave the fiduciary agent our closing cost payment of {$110.00} via check # XXXX. 

On XX/XX/2021 we were notified that our closing cost was not paid at the time of closing by the title company, XXXX via secure email. I responded back with an email stating to their representative that we gave the funds of {$110.00} via check # XXXX to their fiduciary agent. 

I notified our Wells Fargo closing agent of the situation above via email and by phone on XX/XX/2021 of the situation. He, our Wells Fargo closing agent, filed a complaint with the executive office at Wells Fargo - complaint # XXXX. To date, a month later, XXXX states they have not found our paperwork. We received a letter from Wells Fargo that our rate lock would expire on XX/XX/2021. 

All of our sensitive personal information, checking account, SS # 's, Drivers Licenses, Credit reports, were included in the legal documents lost by the fiduciary agent from the title company. Legal documents executed by my husband and I along with the check paid at the time of our signing the legal documents have been lost! It's been a month now and we still don't know who has our information. Wells Fargo, as well as XXXX continue to be lax in moving to rectify this situation. We need to resign the paperwork and Wells Fargo needs to honor the contract or cancel our current mortgage. It is because of the Wells Fargo agent who stated, " I can't tell you who do choose but this company, XXXX the most reputable of the three ''.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I've submitted paperwork TWICE to the mitigation department and have not gotten any response. I have applied for a loan modification over 30 days ago. 

When I call, they give you the runaround. The lender is supposed to be helping people with government backed mortgages and is not operating in good faith.

Product: Student loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was falsely under the impression that this loan was under a deferment or forbearance like other student loans during this international crisis. Apparently, this did not apply to my private student loan. 

This company, Mohela, has put me in financial dire straights before, forced me into bankruptcy, and caused immense amounts of stress on my family due to their horrible communication practices and unwillingness to assist in any way. 

In XXXX, I filed for bankruptcy under pressure from a defaulted student loanwith Mohela. This student loan had fallen into bad standing as I had called Mohela to file for an economic forbearance option and was not informed I had only placed this option on the federal student loan held by Mohela, not the private student loans they also serviced. 

I came out of bankruptcy in XXXX, expecting to have accounts reset and be able to start with a fresh slate, and Mohela had not done any of these things as my other accounts with other creditors had. My forbearances were never reset, I was out of any available options when financial hardships arose, as they had already exhausted these options prior to and during the bankruptcy. 

When the bankruptcy period was over, and payments resumed for this loan, they were entirely too high for my family to afford. We contacted Mohela to put a payment adjustment in place, and they do for a time, but it expires, and each time, we file for a new modification. They want more and more information, and they do not contact us to tell us it's missing. You must log in to the website to find details. 

This year, as stated before, I erroneously thought this company would be giving us relief due to the pandemic, and instead, what they did could only be considered postal harassment. We tried to apply for a payment deferment in XXXX, a payment modification, anything to help get us through, and they denied us for missing income verification. 

Now we are receiving letters telling me I have defaulted on this loan, and to contact the legal department, during a global pandemic, during an unprecedented time, and during a time when student loans were supposed to be offering relief. 

I am feeling backed into a corner here. They offer no options to help.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I have reached out to Midland Mortgage to correct their reporting data to show my account was not past due on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. My account was approved to be in forebearance under the CARES ACT and Midland mortgage advised me that the payments will not be reported to the credit bureau as late payments while under this program. Midland Mortgage in turn did report my account as 90 days and 120 days late to the credit bureaus for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. I disputed the items directly to the credit bureaus and as of XX/XX/XXXX Midland Mortgage continues to report as late payments for this timeframe. I reached out the Midland Mortgage around XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Supervisor ) advised they would correct the inaccurate reporting. XXXX ( Supervisor ) call me around XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX to advise she would correct the reporting by sending the correct information to the credit bureaus. She even emailed me a letter from Midland Mortgage stating the information was inaccurate and should be removed from my credit report. I have a copy of the letter. My chief concern is that even after Midland Mortgage assured me they would rectify the inaccurate reporting, the credit bureaus still to this day are receiving information back from Midland Mortgage that my account is 90 days and 120 days past due for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. Midland Mortgage must immediately correct their system and update the credit bureaus. Due to this inaccurate reporting, I was denied for a mortgage. I am beyond frustrated with Midland Mortgage and wish that they correct their errors.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had XXXX XXXX XXXX that I terminated when I moved in XX/XX/XXXX. Per XXXX XXXX instructions, I placed their modem in a pre-addressed box and shipped it back to them. They later informed me they had not received it. In XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke with a customer Support agent to verify that they had received it. I did not receive any additional communications or bills from XXXX after that date so assumed everything was resolved. 

This month, XXXX of XXXX, I received a notification that a collections had been placed on my XXXX and XXXX  credit reports by IC Systems. I have not received any communications from IC Systems. When I called IC Systems they informed me that the collections was in fact for the unreturned modem, and that they had been sending letters to the address provided by XXXX, where I lived up until XXXX of XXXX. The agent then told me they can not offer any resolution then abruptly disconnected from the call. Of course I never received these letters as they were sent to my old address. 

I checked and my current address is accurate on both my XXXX  and XXXX  credit reports, so would have been available for IC Systems to reference. 

Not only was this debt previously addressed with the original company, XXXX, I received no communications neither from XXXX nor IC Systems informing me they still considered the debt to be outstanding before it was reported to Credit Bureaus.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: I'm trying to set up bi-monthly payments with my existing mortgage provider, American Pacific Mortgage ( XXXX ). I went through their setup process in XX/XX/XXXX and confirmed with my mortgage provider that everything was done correctly on my end. This was supposed to start with my regular XX/XX/XXXX payment, after I made my regular monthly payment in XX/XX/XXXX, which I did. Now I'm being told that I have to make a regular payment in XXXX and in XXXX before this starts. This is 3 months past the point I was previously told that this would start. I don't trust what American Pacific Mortgage is telling me and I feel that I'm not getting a straight answer, or any sort of confirmation when my bi-monthly payment will actually start. I would prefer to work this out directly with American Pacific Mortgage but I don't feel they are being truthful with me, so I'm contacting the CFPB directly.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Originally I was unable to pay my mortgage payments ( about 6 years ago, XXXX when " Obama care '' started, I was unable to bill insurance for massage, my sole income ) and stopped paying. This went on for an extended length of time and I did not know why the bank hadn't foreclosed. I hired a real estate attorney and pursued, the first time in cort my attorney learned that the bank " couldn't prove ownership '' this was somehow " fixed '' and I was approved for a repayment plan and in compliance when my home was sold at foreclosure sale 2 times. The first time, after unsuccessfully attempting to stop the sale, XXXX XXXX, holder of the mortgage went to the sale and bought the home. approx. date ; XXXX XXXX. 
Just over a year later as I continued the repayment plan, the home sold again. My attorney 's firm ( XXXX XXXX ) and XXXX XXXX  attempted to stop the sale, unsuccessfully and were also unable to reverse the sale. XXXX XXXX XXXX, the judge told the bank " pay the buyer his money back ( buyer, at that time was in agreement ) modify the loan and give the home back to mr. XXXX. The bank replied " why doesn't Mr XXXX  just pay the buyer '' my attorney replied if mr XXXX didn't need a bank, we would not be here. The judge then said 'the attorneys need to figure out who's going to pay the buyer and come back to court. approx three months later, in court, the bank still hadn't paid. XXXX XXXX  asked for ( and was granted ) 150 days more to continue negotiations These days will end in XX/XX/XXXX during this time, the attorneys for XXXX XXXX have ceased to follow up wile offering " any assistance '' they sent me all information on my case and encouraged me to get another firm to file lawsuit. I've called the ombudsman department for the mortgage servicer, SPS, and after reviewing my ( now closed ) account, they agreed there is a problem " the house was sold although I was up to date and in compliance with the repayment agreement " but they couldn't go any further as XXXXthe next step is between me and the bank '. I am presently awaiting information via hard mail of the conversation from the ombudsman dep. 
Although my attorney was clear ( before he left XXXX XXXX  ) '' if I sue the bank, I stand a good chance of gaining an astronomical amount of money "

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: Several years ago, all of my money disappeared from my bank account. I received no warning, and I was getting negative account balance fees piling on each other day after day ... My parents stole my money from me, {$20000.00} worth, in a custodial bank account. That by itself is a bit of grey area in the law. However, when I turned XXXX, I walked up to the bank teller, showed her my ID and she refused to open a bank account for me and refused to cancel my direct deposit from my place of work. Now this is completely illegal ... ... Also, over the years I have been acquiring evidence and presenting this evidence to my local BMO Harris branches. They have refused to give me my money bank that I made while working in XXXX XXXX  at XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX ... Along with all of the evidence, I have recently acquired a voicemail from a BMO Harris employee confirming that a large wire transfer happened out of my bank account.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: My account went past due, due to issues with the mail. I called up to pay over the phone. I asked to pay the account off and to close the account. The lady told me the payoff amount which I paid, however the account couldn't be closed until the payment cleared. Which is not true for revolving credit lines, they can be closed with a balance. A few months later I opened a plain envelope to discover that I had a balance of several dollars. I called and they could not waive due to previous late fees waivers. I explained it was due to bank error and I am not responsible for a bank mistake. They had taken my payment as an account payoff. I asked for a return call from a supervisor since none was available. I never received one, nor did I receive one the next time I asked. I am trying to refinance my home and due to the impact of the delinquency on my credit card I did not qualify for the cheapest loan. I had to take one that is {$3000.00} more expensive in closing costs. The refinance can not close until this balance is gone. I called again today and paid the balance since they refuse to resolve the {$1.00} residual interest error that is now {$8.00} with more fees and interest. This is predatory and unacceptable practices. I would like the delinquency removed from my credit report and the {$8.00} refunded to me.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XXXX I received a response from pro collect that they would settle for XXXX instead of XXXX. Which I was thankful for that. But I called and reached out to XXXX XXXX as it stated to in the response, reaching her was difficult I called on multiple days and none of the representative would transfer me to her.. so I submitted a complaint on here again and left a number and XXXX XXXX called and we talked bout resolving the balance. I told her that I couldnt pay the balance of XXXX in full because I was out of work due to covid 19 and she gave me until XXXX to email her on what I could do regarding balance. I emailed her letting her know I still wouldnt be able to pay balance in full. I never received a reply back to the email nor a call. I have been calling still trying to resolve the matter and nothing. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter in the mail stating that I could call and make a pay arrangement. So I called today on XXXX XXXX and was told I couldnt make a payment arrangement and that they will continue to affect my credit report negatively. That a payment is required by XXXX or negative remarks will be added to my credit report.. I have tried over the years to settle this debt and with no resolution. Just rude representative and no compassion or understanding.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I submitted a complaint on XX/XX/XXXX. I received no communication from the company until XXXX via email at XXXX XXXX. I provided a complete response at XXXX XXXX  in which I received no reply via email. I then received a second email at XXXX that they had received my CFPB complaint and subsequently closed it without providing an adequate remedy. Additionally, this indicates that the company did not take this complaint investigation seriously and did not take the time to research the issue. 

As I stated, in the original complaint, this account is fraudulent. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15USC 1692g. The company responded to this complaint via email and subsequently on this complaint. The representative stated, " Our records show that Spotloan made a loan in your name on XX/XX/XXXX, in the amount of {$800.00}. I have independently verified that certain application information matches your name but can not complete my report without your help. '' This is also a violation as per the FDCPA. 

I have not received any validation of such information. I have requested to be provided with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to this debt. I have not receive any. Spotloan also wrote : " Additionally, while you assert we have violated the FDCPA please know that Spotloan is not a debt collector under the FDCPA. Further, we have not owned your loan as of XX/XX/XXXX, we are not affiliated with the XXXX XXXX, and have not attempted to collect on your debt since it was sold to XXXX XXXX " This is another violation of my rights. This is an attempt to collect a debt and as such, Spotloan is liable for this violation under the FDCPA. This office has reported invalidated information to all 3 Major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX  XXXX for five years, which constitute additional fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, the negative marks found on my credit reports by Spotloan and the company that the alleged debt was sold to, is Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character. Further, the information that is being reported is also inaccurate per the companies response. Again, this is fraud and violation of the FDCPA. Pursuant to 15 USC 1692c. ( c ) I am demanded that Spotloan cease all forms of communication with me through any and all mediums. Subsequently, I

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, FL XXXX XXXX : ( XXXX ) XXXX Email : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, DE XXXX Our Account Number : XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, Amount as Listed on Credit Report : {$2600.00} Dated : XX/XX/XXXX To Whom it May Concern : RE : Deceiving or Misleading you while trying to collect a debt. 

On or about XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a XXXX  credit card account with a credit limit of {$4500.00}. XXXX closed my account without notification or any reasons why it was closed. The account went into default there after. On or about XX/XX/XXXX, Credit Control collection Agency, a Agency hired by XXXX XXXX XXXX made contact with me regarding the account in a settlement to delete. I immediately agreed to a settlement to delete all information from all 3 major credit bureaus for {$900.00}. Credit Control was hired my XXXX XXXX XXXX to collect the debt. After the settlement was made Credit Control and XXXX XXXX XXXX refused to remove the debt from my credit file as promised. Instead they have lowered the amount and place a notification on my credit stating : Paid in settlement. {$3500.00} written off. 

Debt collectors are prohibited from deceiving or misleading you while trying to collect a debt. Debt collectors are generally prohibited under federal law from using any false, deceptive, or misleading misrepresentation in collecting a debt.

I was deceived by Credit Control and XXXX XXXX XXXX to collect the debt. I am requesting that XXXX XXXX XXXX either remove the account completely from all 3 major credit bureaus or refund the {$900.00} that they lied to collect. 

I have filed several disputes to XXXX XXXX XXXX and they refused to respond to my request. 
I have attached copies of the payment receipt and copy of the settlement agreement. 

Respectfully Submitted, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In working with Citi cards. They reduced my line of credit down from XXXX to XXXX to the amount that i owed on the account on XXXX of 2020. Then they reported on my credit report that i had maxed out my line of credit. I get it covid and the need to protect their interest. But over the course of the next 11 months i paid on time and tried to pay more than the minimum. On XXXX I paid XXXX down on what i owed on the account and on XXXX they reduced my line of credit down again to the amount that i owed of XXXX. 

Their response was that my reduction was due to my credit score. Well my score stayed flat and even their fico score show only 1 point of movement. Well i ask these questions of citi card 1- If i make another large payment will my line of credit be reduced again ( their response was that they were not sure ) 2- I asked what step i needed to do to help increase my credit score with their company ( their responded was that they do not have any steps or process to improve the score. ) 3 - I asked if i had any late payments or covid paused on the account and they said i has a clean payment record for the past 5 year but they are not sure how this impacts my score.

4 i asked if there was another covid stimulus payment and i applied it to my account what would happen -- they responded that they would love the payment and were not sure if my line of credit would remain the same. 

Long and short citi cards at XXXX are destroying my credit and making it difficult to recover my credit score.

The reason for the large payment was to reduce the amount that i owed and get the maxed out line of credit off of my credit file. I certainly did my part my saving and making my payment on time so this line of acting is damaging to anyone who is trying to recover.

The fact that i am concerned with is that there is a lot of other people that once they are credit line maxed out their credit interest rate also will go up. I have seen other card that i have go up a point or 2 just because of this type of action.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, I have spoken to Governor XXXX XXXX XXXX office which confirmed that per the XXXX website, all Californian 's are under the protection against negative credit reporting and lists my bank, CitiGroup ( Citibank ) as an institution that acknowledges this ordinance. However, Citibank has reported 5 of my accounts negatively throughout XXXX. 
1 ) I have 2 citi credit cards reported as 30 days late in XXXX, XXXX XXXX of XXXX. Citi is aware that I had called 3 times in XXXX to request a covid deferment and they replied that no such program was available. My 3rd call is logged as XX/XX/XXXX wnere no program was avaialble. They launched a program on XX/XX/XXXX after my account was posted late and even after being enrolled in a covid deferment, my 2 cards were reported as late. 

2 ) My 3rd Citi card is reported as late XXXX XXXX and then reported charged off. They would not enroll this card without first requiring it be current after I explained that I was impacted by covid as early as XX/XX/XXXX. 

3 ) My 4th card, Best Buy, backed by CitiGroup, was reported as " Closed by issuer, Never late '' which has a substantial negative impact to credit. There was no reason for this card to have otherwise closed. 

I have made several calls into Citibank. I have reached out to the Executive Response Team and I have not received a resolution. The Governor 's office has requested that I followup with the outcome of this as we believe this to be a wide spread concern against the credit protection ordinance. 

I appreciate your help. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX cc. attachments and screen prints available.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: I paid for the loan application fee. During the approval process our company merged with another company and my wife transferred her ownership to me. I was assured on friday it would be taken care of by close of business. Still getting requests. Horrible response, will not return calls and will not complete what they promise. Horrible experience.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I made an online purchase at XXXX using my store card on XX/XX/2019 and subsequently returned some items from the order within the same month. The balance on my card was not updated correctly to reflect the return and interest was applied to the amount of the returned item. That amount was not paid because I contested it with the credit card company and later a penalty was applied for not paying the interest. They inevitably reversed the amounts when they looked into the charges meanwhile they reported my payment history as 60+ days late in XX/XX/2019 and reduced my credit line. First of all it is impossible to be 60+ days late when not even 60 days could transpire between the purchase date and the month of their reporting. Second of all I was never late as the amount was never owed. Several attempts to resolve with the company have yielded zero results.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi, First off, my loan process was started on XX/XX/XXXX with XXXX XXXX with Sage Mortgage and I specifically selected Sage over XXXX  XXXX because of his wonderful communication and customer service from XXXX. I was able to upload all necessary documentation by XX/XX/XXXX and everything seemed to be going smoothly until XX/XX/XXXX. At this time, my emails and calls remained unanswered until XX/XX/XXXX. This was due to the fact that XXXX was no longer my loan officer. This was never communicated with me, nor contact information provided for the new loan officer. Instead my emails and phone calls simply went unanswered. From there, XXXX XXXX XXXX, my loan processor was the only one working on the loan and it seemed as if she could not access the information I had given to XXXX because duplicate information was requested. Even more concerning, I was told that the information I provided about my condominiums insurance policy was incorrect. So I contacted the insurance company with information given to Sage in order to attain the master policy. They were able to provide this the same day. Considering this is a service that Sage is charging me for, it is odd that I needed to do it for them. 

Thankfully on XX/XX/XXXX I was assigned a new loan officer, XXXX XXXX. His communication was great at first except he, like XXXX, was requesting information that I had already provided weeks ( if not, a month ) earlier. Unfortunately, that same day all communication from XXXX halted and he was unable to get a hold of via email, phone call, or text. Not until XX/XX/XXXX did he contact me again to let me know he couldn't communicate with me because of an issue with his licensure in Colorado. He then halted communication that same day and once again no communication has been provided about my loan. 

My rate has now been extended twice by XXXX. After multiple attempts at talk to a supervisor or manager for months I've yet had success. Please help me figure out what is going on with my loan.

Product: Mortgage

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: I've sent multiple letters to this agency about this not being my account. After being advised by identitytheft.gov, I've completed and sent a fraud affidavit via certified mail. I can see they received it, but nothing has changed. See supporting documents. Even the USPS tracking. My official complaint is against WAYPOINT. My information was used to obtain an apartment, cell phone, and an auto loan with my ex-partner. I am a victim of identity theft and have put this off for too long. I've completed the proper steps, 1. notify creditors 2. police report 3. informed the state of Texas. The individual I've suspected for this theft is now deceased, and the police department said to contact the federal trade commission to seek relief. These companies disregard laws and dont care whos credit or lives they impact.

I guess that they assumed that since I paid my {$500.00} I would be pressured into signing the documents so I wouldn't lose my money. The old bait and switch.

Product: Checking or savings account

I closed my checking account sometime in XX/XX/XXXX. There was a remaining balance of some $ XXXX in the account. When I called to close the account I was assured this amount would be mailed to me by check. I asked the representative to please confirm the mailing address that the check would be sent to, as the mailing address ( PO Box ) is different from the physical address on my account. No check. 

I called Citi again in XX/XX/XXXX, and was told the check was returned to them as undeliverable. Citi mailed the check to my physical address ( which doesn't accept mail ). I explained that I told the first agent this exact thing the first time and was assured it would be sent to the correct place. This new agent told me that the mailing address on my account was my physical address. I explained this was wrong ( and an error on their side ), because my debit card and PIN when I opened the account were correctly delivered to my mailing address, and I double-checked with the first agent anyway! This agent relented, and again assured me it would be sent out to my mailing address. No check. 

I called Citi again in XX/XX/XXXX, and was again assured by the agent that he would take personal responsibility that it was resolved and sent to my mailing address. No check. 

All of this information is in their call logs and notes on my account, and each agent could see the issue and that I had called before and the check wasn't delivered. 

It is now XXXX XXXX, and I'm done. I want my $ XXXX. I want them to mail it to my mailing address, or hand deliver it, I don't care. Please help! Thank you!

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX there was a charge on my checking account for {$1500.00}. I immediately marked it as fraud with my bank because I did not make that charge. At the end of XXXX they sent me a letter stating that their investigation was now closed and the charge would be reversed and posted to my account on XX/XX/XXXX because their investigation concluded that it was a verified and accurate charge. This was incorrect so I called them the same day, spoke to a woman who said she would reopen the investigation. Yesterday was XX/XX/XXXX and my account was hit for the {$1500.00}. I called them today on XX/XX/XXXX and was told they have 45 business days to conclude their investigation ( again ). This has been ongoing since XX/XX/XXXX, no information of the investigation was given to me. They've also taken my money that I need for bills and feeding my family and we don't have 45 days to wait. 

I did my own investigation and found out the charge was for a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX table in downtown XXXX, Tx. I live in XXXX, AZ. I have proof that I used my debit card in XXXX  XXXX, Arizona a week before XXXX. I have picture proof that I was with my family at my house in XXXX, AZ on XXXX. I've never even heard of this club, the website it was charged ( have never used it ), and would absolutely NOT be in XXXX, Tx. 

I personally believe my debit card was skimmed at a bank owned ATM. I use my debit card for ATM withdrawals at the drive-thru bank, the last time it was used before the fraud charge was on 10/26.This is the only logical and possible way this occurred. It was absolutely NOT me that made this charge and I'm disturbed how this bank has taken my money with no due diligence of their own in their fraud investigation.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Being lied to or given misleading information by a company is considered both an unfair and deceptive practice and is in violation of Unfair, Deception, and Abusive Acts Practices ( UDAAP ), under the Dodd-Frank Consumer Financial Protections Act of XXXX. 

Account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I filed a dispute for a {$310.00} charge from a fraudulent company overseas, which was shut down by XXXX. The dispute was closed in my favor in XXXX of XXXX, but then PayPal charged me again because the seller said he sent the product to me, which did not even arrive until XXXX - 3 months after the dispute was closed. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: During my XXXX divorce, I was left with an XXXX balance on a XXXX credit card and no way to make the payments. XXXX reached out with a settlement offer about the same time as I was considering bankruptcy. I consulted with XXXX XXXX of XXXX XXXX about what would be the better option for my credit report. My plan was to obtain a mortgage and purchase a property to flip and start to support myself, so I wanted to impact my credit the least amount possible. Mr XXXX drafted a letter to accompany my check requiring XXXX to agree to delete all negative reporting info in exchange for cashing the check .... or that they needed to return it. The letter was XXXX clear. It was sent and even cashed by XXXX before the deadline they gave me. 8 months later, XXXX is still reporting it as a charge off and settled for less than amount owed. Clearly negative info. They have been contacted several times by both Mr XXXX and myself, but they decline to return the calls. Mr XXXX has drafted FIVE letters over the last 8 months to each of the 3 credit reporting agencies and enclosing copies of the same items for them to review. All we get in return is a form letter saying the info has been verified as accurate. Clearly providing them proof of the agreement isnt helping. I have lost out on several different properties due to the impact this item is having on my score. It is the only negative mark and causing me to be offered a rate 2x the regular one. The letter clearly stated that by cashing the check, they agreed to the terms and that if they did not, the deal was not ok with me.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
After reviewing my XXXX Credit Report, on XX/XX/XXXX I realized then that I had been a victim of the Identity Theft. I did not apply for a Citi Cards CBNA Credit Card Loan. The account had to be fraudulently opened on XX/XX/XXXX. I suspect the perpetrator had forged my signature and used my personal and confidential information. 
I filed the Identity Theft report with the Federal Trade Commission XXXX FTC ) Identity Theft Bureau and reported the identity theft to the XXXX XXXX Sheriff Office XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have swiftly complied when Citi Cards CBNA representatives when asked for information. I have provided my email address, proof of identity, telephone number and home mailing address. I have provided carbonless check stubs that were fraudulently made out to Citi Cards. I have provided samples of the suspected perpetrator signature and location of the same. 
I have sent Citi Cards CBNA Services three letters requesting information pursuant to section 609 ( e ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), California Financial Code sections 4002 and 22470, Civil Code section 1748.95 and Penal Code 530.8. Also included in the three letters I had provided the following : FTC Cover letter, FTC Identity Theft Report, proof of my identity, FTC Notice to Furnishers of Information, XXXX  Victim release form titled Identity Theft Victims Request for Fraudulent Transaction/Account Information ( Form A ), XXXX XXXX Sheriff Incident Report, and a separate document ( Attachment A ), detailing requested information on the fraudulent account. 
After 30 days, Citi Cards CBNA had only sent statements dating back to XXXX of XXXX but no documents dating back to XX/XX/XXXX or anything with my signature. On XX/XX/XXXX the Citi Bank representative informs me that Citi Bank CBNA can not give me the signed application. Citi Customer Services has ignored my three requests for documents and refuses to make reference to the XXXX  criminal case number in any correspondence they have generated. Citi Bank Services refuses to comply with the request for information that I am lawfully in my right to request.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Army Air Force Exchange Service ( AAFES ) refuses to stop reporting a derogatory item against my personal credit report despite presentation of documentation that proves the existence of mitigating circumstances tied to active duty military service. After I was ordered to active duty from the reserve component, an automatic allotment that I had setup to make automatic payments against my open XXXX XXXX XXXX ( credit card offered and managed by AAFES ) did not immediately carry over. I was ordered to attend an intense military training pipeline that spanned approximately 20 months and included multiple short-notice relocations during that timeframe ( see attached sets of orders ). Additionally, the Creditor is in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act because I was never provided prior notification of pending material changes to my credit report. It was only after reaching my final base that I learned something was wrong. One of my paychecks was approximately XXXX smaller than normal. Upon reconciliation of the reserve and active pay systems, the XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) automatically sent a single payment to close the remaining outstanding balance still open against the account held by the named Creditor ( reference the attached Leave and Earnings Statement ). In effect, by the time I realized something was wrong, the Creditor had already sent the account into collections. The Creditor claims to have sent notification ; however, the last address they had on file was my reserve unit HQ building -- even though this makes no sense as the XXXX XXXX is a personal credit card requiring a residential address during the application/sign up process ( which I provided ). Personnel at my reserve unit were not able to verify receipt of any personal notifications addressed to me from AAFES during my absence. 

I have attempted to work directly with the Creditor and all three Credit Reporting Agencies XXXX see attached email correspondence and dispute letters XXXX. I have even retained legal representation ( see attached legal notices from XXXX XXXX XXXX ). The Creditor states that the decision rests with the CRAs. The CRAs state that the decision rests with the Creditor. All involved parties refuse to coordinate and simply shift the responsibility. I have already filed a complaint against the CRAs, but was unable to also list AAFES. This complaint is specifically intended for the named Creditor.

Product: Debt collection

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of 2017, I opened a checking account with Bank of America. In XXXX of 2017, I deposited a check into the account that ended up being drawn on an account that had just been closed, although I did not know it. My account was immediately frozen. I called customer service, and they told me what had happened and suggested that I go speak to the manager of the bank branch where I had opened the account, who should be able to lift the freeze. 

When I went to the bank to see the manager, I was accompanied by my XXXX  granddaughters, who are XXXX. The manager stared at them, and it was obvious to me that because he was white, he was making a XXXX judgment on me ( I'm also white ) for having XXXX grandchildren. He was very rude to me and told me that because the deposit I made was returned, it caused several checks I had written to bounce. Although the account was not overdrawn, because I had bounced a check in the first 30 days, he said that bank had to close my account. The manager returned to me the money that was still in the account, and closed it during my visit. He assured me that there would be no negative reporting ramifications from the closure, as it was not my fault. 

Recently, I attempted to open an account with a different bank and was denied. I obtained a copy of my XXXX  Report ( as recommended by the denying bank ) to see why I had been denied, and I noted that Bank of America had reported me to XXXX in 2017, indicating they had closed my account due to " suspected fraud ''. This is completely inaccurate. The XXXX report also indicated that I had an unpaid amount owed to BofA as a result of the closed account, which is also inaccurate. 

I contacted BofA several times to request that they remove the false information from XXXX, but the customer service reps I spoke with said they were unable to do so, but could not provide me any valid reason why ( as they agreed with me as to why my account had been closed and confirmed I did not owe BofA any money ). 

The false and negative report by Bank of America to XXXX is preventing me from opening any bank accounts, which I need to do for my small business. I am being harmed severely every day that the false information remains on the report.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a new car from XXXX XXXX XXXX of XXXX, NJ in XXXX XXXX. Approximately one month after the purchase I discovered an issue. When purchasing the vehicle XXXX XXXX input the incorrect contact information on my account. The social security number, DOB, etc. on the account does not match mine. For this reason I am unable to access any online services for this loan, including my account number, online payment, and most importantly auto-pay. My only way to pay XXXX was to pay over the phone when they called me. They didn't call in XXXX, I can only assume this was due to COVID. I contacted XXXX  on multiple occasions but they were never able to fix the issue. 

In XX/XX/XXXX I realized that XXXX XXXX were reporting a late payment on my account from XX/XX/XXXX. At that time I attempted to reach-out to XXXX XXXX via phone at least 5 times to address the reported late payment. I was told by the front line customer service reps that there was nothing they could do to resolve the reported late payment, despite the incorrect information on my account, and that a manager would call me back. The managers called at times when I was unavailable, so I returned their calls leaving voicemails each time. I never received additional follow-up from them. 

In addition to calls directly to XXXX XXXX, I've sent them a letter outlining the situation and asking them to change their credit bureau reporting. I've also reported the error through the credit bureau dispute processes. Unfortunately, none of these efforts have led to resolution of this issue. 

XXXX XXXX 's inaccurate reporting is significantly negatively impacting my life. Tonight I attempted to finance a new cell phone ( only a {$1000.00} purchase ) and was denied by two different banks. If this one late payment were removed from my account XXXX XXXX estimates my credit score increases from 660  to the 750 range. This late payment seems to be the only reason for denial of my credit applications. 

Thanks in advance for your help!

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

This account should have been removed from my credit reports in XXXX of this year, however now it is has once again continued to stay on my report and XXXX XXXX nor the 3 Credit Bureaus will correct the dates and remove this information as they should according to the FCRA and Federal Law. 

The date of first delinquency on this account was XXXX, XXXX. This means that according to the FCRA and Federal Law this account should have been removed. I am not sure what sort of games XXXX XXXX is playing but every time I call to speak with a rep, no one will work with me. I have contacted and disputed this information with all 3 credit reporting agencies and they continue to report the innacurate information. According to XXXX XXXX, Experian, XXXX and XXXX now the date of first delinquency is XX/XX/XXXX. This means that this will now be on my reports for another year or more. 

I have tried every other means to correct this issue with all parties involved and no one will listen or cares enough to actually investigate as they should to see that this information has continued to change year after year. 

It is extremely frustrating that these company 's are allowed to do this to the average consumer like myself and hurt our chances of improving our positions in life. I am not excusing the fact that I allowed this account to go delinquent and then be charged off but this was over 7 and half years ago and I am doing everything in my power to do the right things. 

You can't keep changing the finish line because you want to harm consumers, it isn't right nor legal.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a statement in XXXX from Sears Mastercard. I noticed that I had been charged late fees and interest charges on that statement. I always pay my statement seven days in advance of the due date and have never had a problem being charged late fees and interest charges. I immediately called customer service and asked them why they were charging me late fees and interest charges. Sears customer services stated they had received the payment late. It was determined in this conversation that the mail either had been held up or the payment had not been processed in a timely matter at the Sears Office. Customer Service said they would waive the charges. While talking with Customer Service, I pulled XXXX statement and noted that Sears had also charged a late fee and interest charge for that month. Customer Service stated that they had not received my payment in time for that month. Customer Service waived the late fee and interest charge for that month. I had to call back the next day to have those fees waived as Customer Service stated that could not waive fees for two consecutive months in one call. 

I received my XXXX Statement on XX/XX/2021 and it indicates that Sears is charging {$7.00} interest for purchases. I called Sears and talked with XXXX at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2021. I questioned why I was being charged an interest charge for purchases. I asked that this charge be waived and explained the circumstances with prior Customer Service calls. She stated that it is their policy that no additional waivers can take place after the two waivers for the prior months. This was not discussed with me by the prior Customer Services Representatives that did the initial waivers. 

I am disputing this charge because I have been faithful in making my payments on time for many years that I have held a Sears Credit Card. These late fees and interest charges were not due to my error but due to the lag in postal service, COVID pandemic and the lack of personnel to process payments issued to Sears Mastercard.
